sy_P62Tnc5ccNycMB49jvg.text: I've been here a few times. It seems like I go about every 6 months because it takes about that long to forget the prior experience.   I had the Chimichanga (fried burrito). There is no way that it is better than the Qdoba across the parking lot. It's basically the same thing. But this is True of a lot of Mexican food - it seems like you pay double if it comes with a plate. Someone has to wash a plate. So maybe that makes sense.  3 people - no alcohol - no drinks (water) - no appetizer - 3 entries and the bill including tip was over $50.00. Fast food Mexican without the plate for the same meal would have been less than $20.00.  Maybe it will be better 6 months from now - I'll keep you posted !

X0xGSUJKpWw3LAv7BDe2Sw.text: Met a girlfriend for dinner while I was in town. I made a reservation on opentable to make sure we had a seat. The service staff were nice and very attentive. We both ordered from their taco menu. I love that you can mix and match :-) I had the carne asada and tilapia taco, both were delicious! You won't be disappointed!   I liked it so much I took my family back two days later :-) make sure you get the fresh guacamole!

R5Wf1IwbRdzta-WEy2FnPQ.text: Tried Cantina for the first time on Thursday as I received a voucher for Christmas. We sat at a hightop in the bar area and the service was great. Our server/bartender was very knowledgeable and friendly. He made some great recommendations for both food and drink, especially the appetizer of corn cakes with Mexican style pulled pork which were amazing. The menu had the usual fare with a few more unique items and everything we had was delicious.

GqAPjOYM6ax3y7Si-EXTOw.text: Love their staff and specially their AMAZING QUESO! I could literally eat their tortillas and queso all day! We came in a few weeks back after the snow storm left us to walk to get food. As a younger couple, we didn't think to buy food in advance. Lol! Upon entering we were given a warm welcome and were served by an awesome guy! I want to say his name was hunter? Or Charles? He was an awesome server and gave us exceptional service! We were very happy when we walked home with full bellies and to go plates full of more chips and left overs! Thanks Hunter/Charles for being so nice to us! :)

LHCCsGzpz7mHpVySLnl0zw.text: Unique selections. The burritos are HUGE and very good. The lump crab & avocado quesadilla is my favorite. Table-side guacamole is also delicious.   Has complimentary valet  and outside seating.

lWlyENm9CFGkChTs8TmEiA.text: I've tried making guacamole at home with everything Cantina 1511 uses for the tableside preparation, but it must be a mystery, because theirs is impossible to recreate. The menu is extensive and loaded with more choices than Netflix on a good day. The recent menu redesign has lots of bright colors and looks like a Post-It note cram session, prompting many bad memories (geology finals) and the waiter promising any kind of guidance with the menu/counseling for bad exam experiences. Service: 1. Redesign: 0.  The menu breaks down into different categories: comida autentica mexicana (which lists Mexican specialties in Spanish) and Tex Mex Standards. Picking out just a few tacos from the Magnificent Seven is tricky, but the pescado frito (fish) taco is pretty spectacular. I like the creative fish tacos or the carnitas, but the ancho chicken salad is my favorite. Tossed with chopped romaine lettuce and garbanzo beans, the flavors are familiarly Mexican, but the dish is fresh and just as filling as an enchilada. Prices are a little bit higher, reflecting a quality difference with other Tex-Mex joints, which I think is pretty justifiable.  The inside's a little noisy, but just like the menu, the paper mobile decorations and a banging Spanish poster of Gone With the Wind are a contemporary update of the Tex Mex cantina. Whenever I'm in town, my sister and I make a point to stop here.

hLKdtnNfaklOo9rT4LcucA.text: Another place that is a local favorite that I am just not down with.  I will repeat what other reviewers have stated - overpriced.  Meaning, the exorbitant prices are not justified by the quality of the product or the experience.  I am perfectly content with Azteca, Monterrey, etc. - fair prices for a mixture of beans, rice and meat in some form of a tortilla.    On a Sunday at 11:30, there was a sparse crowd.  We were seated immediately by a guy who was rubber-banding crayons for kids (don't get me started - I am going to start eating at titty bars to avoid breeders and their ill-mannered spawn).  Our server was friendly enough, minimal chatting and kept the fresh drinks coming, so points for that.    The food: A small bowl of super-salty tortilla chips, from what I imagine was the bottom of the bag.  Mostly broken pieces, but the waitress did bring a new batch with mostly whole chips once she saw the basket of chip shards/dust.  Served with salsa, which I didn't eat any of to save room for the queso Queso - $9.50.  That's right - that's a 9.  Almost $10 for a crock of barely melted cheese and a few onions thrown in for texture.  You would think it would taste like cotton candy, sex and hundred dollar bills for $10.  Nope.  Cheese.  Just cheese.  And a couple of onion slices.  Served with warm flour tortillas to go along with our over-salted chips.  It's cheese, so I ate it, but it wasn't in my top 10 queso list.  Putting it in a small, fancy crock with a tea candle under it doesn't justify the 1000% markup.  Fail.   Carne Asada Steak Burrito - $12.75.  The burrito was HUGE, like took up half of the plate huge.  And while I am a big believer in the theory that size matters, this was a lot of burrito.  I noticed that it was served with slaw, lettuce, tomato, sour cream and guacamole on the side, and being used to the aforementioned mexican joints, I wondered where the rice and/or beans were?  They are stuffed in the giant burrito, along with corn, peas and carrots (?) and the steak (which was fine, nothing special).  It was good.  I ate about 1/3 at the restaurant and ate the rest for dinner.  It reheated well and was okay.  I had not been to Cantina for many years, the last time I went they cilantro'ed the shit out of everything after I had asked for no cilantro.  After yesterday's visit, it will be many more years before I return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Giant carne asada steak burrito - $12.75
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso appetizer - $9.50

3Kg4_WcpmSo4OmXjF8m3-g.text: Oh my good news the queso dip was outstanding! Our server Justin was very good to us! The food that we had was good. My wife had the quesidilla and I had the pork dish! They were both very good, and we came and sat down within 5 minutes of our reservation time, which they said they were behind! Definitely recommend this place

D3a02xXXXq9HB_6C-UNM1g.text: Been there twice. First time, they told me they can't seat us because they have possible reservations and the place was empty. That should have been the sign.  Well, we tried it again today , and it was horrible, the people did not wait on us. We had to sit by the bar. Service was terrible. I will never go back.

75pQPekO3iwbPWY7uZf3zg.text: Came here during the lull of a Sunday. Very friendly bartenders and my food came out extremely quickly. Had a couple house margaritas and the tequila was still decent quality! Prices were pretty average and everything met my expectations. Wish I new the bartenders names but they did a great job working together to make sure I never had an empty drink or was left wanting anything. The chips and salsa were very fresh and the chips were served warm! I will be back!

yS5L8bhnoGfallcBwYje1Q.text: It has been years since I have been to Cantina 1511 (the other location on East Blvd).  Food review: The chips were over salty and greasy.  The guacamole made fresh at the table was pretty good, I only wish it had some more tomatoes in it.  My meal was not very good - the chicken and spinach enchiladas.  They were really bland.  Not much seasoning.  I had to dump a bunch of salsa on they to even be interested in eating my meal.  The beans seemed like they were not totally cooked all the way, as they were sort of hard.     Quite honestly, I remember the food being better at the other location.  Maybe I caught them on a bad night?  Or maybe the other location is better.

lVH7tKAzKyVD0C1xlEwI6Q.text: Very good margaritas and my tacos were delicious. We very much enjoyed our visit! Also, they were pet friendly which was great for eating on the outside patio with our puppy.

T23xpi7dMG95xAgKBdyWoQ.text: My dining experience at Cantina/Stonecrest last week was above average, rating a 4 out of 5. While it was a Monday night, the restaurant was packed. I ordered a margarita at the bar while waiting for my friends and my table. Once we got seated, we joked about how no one wanted to wait on us because we looked like we were having too much fun. Finally, we got our chips and salsa (fresh!) and placed our orders.   I am totally addicted to nachos. The messier the better! And, it's great value at Cantina if you're watching your pennies, which I am!   The nachos that I ordered was a huge portion. Enough for two people easily. Fresh guacamole and sour cream was not spared in the least. I had to order jalapenos (forgot when I originally placed my order), but they were brought out quickly. Freshly sliced and spicy!   I order Tres Leches cake off the menu. It was dry with a whipped topping that I expected to be homemade and fresh, but seemed to come straight from a can.   Cantina is definitely one of my "go to" places. I loved how they can make a mean Jalapeno margarita if you ask them and if you're going out for Restaurant Week, make sure Cantina is on your list. Of all the places I've visited over the last few years during Restaurant Week, Cantina gives you the best for the value!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great bar!

qEOQ7SSxInkG5dx63V2vvg.text: No hostess when I walked in. Had to wait a few minutes to be greeted. Server was good! Name was Stan in case anyone wants to request him. Guacamole was VERY GOOD! Table side presentation and very fresh. The queso dip was Meh, ok. I ordered the Salmon. The fish itself was cooked perfectly but it was very oily and needed more sauce and goat cheese.  It came with roasted tomatoes which were very oily in my opinion.  The tres leches cake is NOT like a traditional Mexican dessert. There's a marshmallow spread on top which makes it very sweet and takes over the whole dish.  Service was good and the food was ok.  I give it a 3 stars for the creamy fresh guacamole and the salmon that was cooked just right, but that's about it.

-wDt-_0DYBf8LbntGmrfIQ.text: I guess this is my first yelp review!  Ok, so the food is good and the prices are slightly steep for a Mexican restaurant.  It has a nice modern atmosphere and not your neighborhood Mexicans restaurant feeling.  Overall I gave them a four star because the food could have tasted better and not so blah, and the prices are too high for most things.  Would I go back? Yes nit my first choice though.

SeY-IkQCQejbrVRB4aVEuQ.text: My husband brought me and my mom here for Mother's Day lunch as this used to be one of my favorite places as I loved their drinks. He made reservations almost a month in advance. When we arrived, there was an abbreviated, pre-fixe Mother's Day menu, which we were not made aware of in advance.  I was a little disappointed that I could not get the Barbacoa I'd always liked so much. We were initially a party of 3 and my son said he couldn't make it so we went ahead and ordered our food, After waiting a really long time and no food, my son suddenly appeared. We put in an order for him as well. After waiting another excruciatingly long time, a server appears with a plate of food. ONE plate. It was the dish my son had ordered. He arrived about 30 minutes after us, and got his food first. Since it just so happened that he and my mother ordered the same choice, he gave the plate to her so she could start eating as the server promised that the rest of our food would be right out. However, at the time that she FINISHED her plate and the rest of our food hadn't been brought out, I caught the eye of a hostess checking tables (as our server was nowhere to be found for long periods) and asked her to please check on the rest of our food. 5 minutes later, the rest of the food comes. My fajita platter - which was some dried out chicken and mushy peppers and a single flour tortilla, was cold. Not even lukewarm, but cold. I immediately had to flag down another hostess, again, our server was elsewhere for long periods, and asked her to get me a manager. Manager comes, apologizes for the "kitchen" mixup and says he will remake my meal. FIVE MINUTES later, I have a piping hot fajita platter in front of me, this time with TWO WHOLE flour tortillas. Yay? Nay. While it was hot, it was bland and unseasoned. Not sure how tex-mex ends up unseasoned. We were all so disappointed with this experience they completely ruined my mothers day luncheon. We are not interested in returning here again. Not even for the drinks.

TZzrFL-mO6BIpsrT6c5peg.text: Not impressed. Alcoholic beverages were good.... don't sit in the patio! Unless you want to eat flies and gnats.

X4se-tSCpjDIA9eTPKd6XA.text: Not a huge menu, but a nice selection of tacos, tortas, etc.  Server was nice and friendly, but wasn't knowledgable of what was on the menu. I asked about the appetizer "Antojitos" and had no idea. I asked him to find out, he comes back with vague descriptions with Spanish names I'm still not familiar with and neither is he. I once again asked to find out what is was. Really? I ordered it based in his description and it came out and was different than what he said. Normally, I'd send it back but was starving. Wasn't bad. It was mostly fish, we think. It included small potatoes croquettes, some type of cheese mini burrito, I think swordfish on a chip. We each ordered one taco, the crispy pork. I asked how big they were in case they were the small ones, I'd order two. His answer was "regular size".   I ordered it anyway and was a nice size and very flavorful. The rice and beans that came with it was DELICIOUS! I'd go back, but they need to school the staff on what the food is and their descriptions. I know a lot about food, but I'm no ethnic expert. Help me out Here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Your guess is as good as mine. The empty spot was what I think were potatoes or cod croquettes. It was all good tho.
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork tacos with rice and beans

zVGgH4DTyF0DlPeki0oBbQ.text: The place answers the question "How can you mess up enchiladas?".  By smothering them in a cheesy mess and playing "hide the chicken", they do so quite convincingly.  The food is overpriced and they are surely fortunate to get a spillover crowd when the wait at Firebirds exceeds an hour as it often does.

-NUaB7RIm5jmvW-n3DzO_w.text: I gave this place 4 stars strictly based on their table side guacamole.  That is a True test when it comes to a "mexican restaurant" and Cantina definitely doesn't disappoint when it comes to their guac!  It is fresh, flavorful and spiced to perfection!    As far as everything else is concerned....it is just OKAY, in my opinion.  It is a trendy, mexican-fusion restaurant so you get what you pay for...and you pay quite a bit!  Everything is typically pretty fresh and tasty but I don't know if the prices are justified.    Maybe it's just me, but I can't fathom valet parking and waiting an hour for mexican food.  I like my mexican food straight up, authentic and dirty and so the "hype" around this place is just a little corny to me.    The parking lot is too small for the volume of guests but they DO take reservations so that is a good thing.    All in all it is a fun, good place to eat but make sure you have realistic expectations before going!  And, remember--the guacamole alone is worth the visit!

kF_U95iQWiRoNJ_VAvn9MQ.text: My favorite is the El pastor and shrimp poboy tacos..  The guacamole is alway made with love and there salsa is great kick

J5lmWxA8rdLEuOwlf7b7sg.text: You pretty much can't go wrong with ANYTHING you order here and drinks are awesome as well. Very creative takes on the usual Mexican and Texmex favorites. Fresh, flavorful, great presentation, superb service and prices are very reasonable. Great for lunch or dinner. Fun atmosphere too. Highly recommend!

Ci39eShXUj_dVSWGAjSyUw.text: I ordered wrong, but that's on me. The chips & salsa were great and the boys all loved their meals, so I'm sure we will be back.

XslBn9hBHHn-GRF7dBNt8g.text: Service was very slow. Our party waited forever and ended up not even getting what we ordered. A weren't discounted for it! There is nothing special about the food or the salsa. It is pretty expensive also. Won't be back, plenty of better Mexican restaurants.

VmL1dm-it6y5ZS01_mdG7A.text: Every time we come here, the service is horrible. Came in with a crowd of 8 and got sat on the patio. We all ordered drinks from the bar and they were watered down as if they were sitting there. Got 1 order of chips and salsa and never got a chance to get a refill. One of the girls was missing her dish. Couldn't even get the server to tell him. Finally told him and he said they will make it soon. After 15 mins she still didn't get it. They finally came to give her her food and she told them she didn't want it anymore because of the wait. That is ridiculous for her to not have her plate of food and to wait that long. One girl ordered guacomole appetizer and didn't even get a chance to ask for chips. Terrible. Food isn't even good.

5LcSQ22YAnuuAG0olAWRoA.text: The food was so bad! I ordered two guacamole bowls, and it tasted like someone dumped a load of salt into both of them!! I also ordered the chicken chimichanga. It was full of black beans and little to no chicken at all!! Not to mention, the guacamole sides that came with the chimichanga was so small (maybe a pinch of lettuce and a teaspoon of the tomatoes). Compared to the CANTINA 1511 at the Park Road Shopping Center, which is great btw, this restaurant drops far low beyond the "restaurant acceptable" range. If I had to say, McDonald's or a Chinese Buffet would probably be better than what I experienced/ate at the Cantina 1511 at StoneCrest. Never going back here again. Waste of my money. I could have gone to the Nothing But Noodles or ChickFilA across the street and actually enjoyed my food. We took a to go box home only to have it thrown away.

jBvnHk8DQfZ3aeh533NCZA.text: More upscale place than other Tex Mex place. Food is good and the portions are as well. Love the salsa and queso.  A lot of taco options and plates to choose from. Everything seemed really fresh. Price is a little higher but at least the food and service was good. We recommend this place.

UrkIBSeKWqT2p1LFikaA6g.text: Good, but not great. Wish it lived up to my expectations. But, it is my favorite Mexican restaurant in this area. The Queso is very good though, really recommend.

8XeZNbAcPsuJZWJ398zyVQ.text: The Al Pastor tacos and mojitos are outstanding. I ate here 2 nights in a row. (Why mess with a good thing?)

qswSiUnV6EPe493cyb-XNA.text: Awesome brunch option! Will go back for dinner for sure! Came here with the whole fam and everyone was impressed. I'm not a huge brunch guy (we went for lunch) but when I looked at the brunch menu I was intrigued...and I'm glad I tried it...really cool twist on eggs Benedict with Arepas in place of the English muffins. Can't explain how good this was. Kids had lunch quesadillas and wife had a Chimichanga everything was awesome...we'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Arepas Benidict...ridiculously good!!

J40BFhsGR0iEt595wL0RGA.text: To be fair, I wrote an e-mail to the General Manager first, and he didn't respond after over a week so here's my update.  Went for lunch a week and a half ago, it was for my daughters birthday lunch and she loves Cantina 1511 as does my whole family.    The restaurant had a large number of flies, so much so that they impeded my families enjoyment of their lunch.  The flies were pretty bad during the chips and salsa stage but got worse when the meal arrived.  They asked to be moved and they were accommodated.  Once they moved a Manager (female) came over and offered a lame explanation about it being summer and flies are to be expected.      They finally left after paying for their meal which couldn't be eaten because they were pretty disgusted because of the fly issue.  It was a slow lunch day and not many people were in the restaurant.  They left after splitting the bill with the other party, the bill was around $60.00 ($28.22 which was half the bill).     Normally we like the restaurant and my wife who isn't a complainer her opinion is that she doesn't want to go back, which, I'm sure isn't what they want to hear  My kids didn't want to eat the food they boxed up and brought home because of the memories of the flies.  My wife has worked in restaurants for many years and I am in the commercial food industry, and we know there are sprays out there that can eliminate flies.  The managers explanation simply doesn't cut it and it sounds like she needs some retraining on how to respond to customer issues.

rjBr40ZAzzKNUU78jxPhgg.text: This is a hit or miss place based on who your server is. Last time we had an excellent waiter and hence we had a great time. Today we had a terrible waitress. We sat down and she came over for the drink order. No sooner did we order then she started with "Your not from here are you." She was loud and rude but ok I wasn't going to get upset. I ordered a meal that did not list raw tomato as an ingredient because I am allergic to it. When my meal came there was raw tomato all over it. I said something to the waitress who snarked at me that she would send the manager over.  The manager never appeared nor did any drink refills. We had to flag the waitress down to get the check as she was busy standing near the door starring out into space. They really need to check on their staff. This girl was rude and inept at her job

esLNy5MxaTCUoUMQtCOLtQ.text: Perfect spot on a nice summer night. Mondays are specials for cocktails! The Devils garden had a strong hint of spiciness and sweetness. The food choices for steak, tacos are go to. Dustin is an awesome host, be sure to ask for him!

yJyrdmZ6I-mcrHW6ZNXlFw.text: Let's start with the positive - the food is pretty darn good. The steak fajitas were served with a very tasty mix of chargrilled veggies. The Carne Asada was also very good.  However, all the positives were totally negated by the worst service I can ever remember in a restaurant. I would also say the cleanliness of our table was bad but that may be the results of the poor skills of our server.  I will go back and give it another try because the food was that good.

Vcohzr-HJrDrthD9EZen0A.text: Great place to enjoy a meal after a summer movie! Food and service exceptional. The enchiladas verdes was fantastic! We will definitely return!

8nuTRN_duZc6EPfkkVNlSA.text: We've never had a bad meal here! The salsa is wonderful and so are the entrees. Make sure to get a margarita and the Nutella pie for dessert. If you haven't been here, make sure to put it at the top of your list!

ztTebDaeSgKyD1CJdAnBqQ.text: Terrific food here with our server Alicia tonight.  Always a pleasant place to come!  Great service!

F03fqqJYqpiKw-toku5CJA.text: First time eating at Cantina 1511. In town for business and asked hotel place to go. Highly recommended this place. Seated right away. Super friendly staff. Started with queso fundido with chorizo. Wow! Delicious!!!!  Service was spot on. Food came quickly. Generous portions and very tasty. Great presentation too. Def check it out when  in south Charlotte. Server James was fantastic and super friendly too

cbgCBzfu-iqFZ7AfgNnQ6g.text: Excellent food and service!  Jason, our server, was very attentive, friendly, and professional.  We loved the fresh tortilla chips and tasty salsa.  We ordered the delicious guacamole that Jason made fresh at our table.  Everything was great including the chicken burrito and carne asada bowls we devoured!   Fun & festive atmosphere!

rUoyKiO8i5C9D_Y3Zsdn9w.text: We eat here all the time & always leave happy!  Service is good, food consistently good, usually able to get in:)

Ma65X98uAYQju1NgRAu_Iw.text: Service was horrible.  We walked in and the hostess was talking to two men in the bar area.  There isn't much of a waiting area and there were four of us so we steppedmout ofmthe way. A couple came into the restaurant and walked to the podium...the waitress seated them right away, before even talking to us!  We waited about 15 minutes to get a seat...and then were seated in the bar area.  My husband ordered a beer.  They didn't have it.  He selected a second beer.  They didn't have that one eother.  The food was pretty good.  But when the bill came, we were charged for the beer!  For the price of the food the service should be better.  I was shocked when the bill came.

-yFqyenq2RMgH3KiBusHxA.text: Great Mexican food with a Gluten Free menu for wifey!

1UEnN_t8bSWvfRf5vTWc4Q.text: I was recently in Charlotte and had a white sangria at Cantina.  If anyone knows the recipe please post and if you haven't tried this drink be sure and order it the next time you are there!!!

STxXK44wTOh5g3fufrgFng.text: This is my 2nd bad review of this restaurant, the 1st i did via open table back in august 2014 but chose this way since it is more visible and again it is my 2nd bad review and perhaps it will be noticed more by the restaurant. My husband and I decided to do an impromptu supper/movie date night. The restaurant next door had a 1.5 hour wait, cantina had none so we chose to go there. We were sat immediately and noticed that the seating had changed as did the look of the menu. We waited, and waited at our table and were not acknowledged at all by anyone.  My husband and I are very patient, we both worked in the industry and understand things can get busy but it is expected that someone should have acknowledged us, even if it was to say "ill be right with  you". I looked at my cell phone  after being there a bit and said to my husband "if no one comes in 3 minutes were are leaving", I waited 4 and we got u p and left. We stopped by the hostess stand to let them know why we were leaving and decide to walk to one of the other restaurants in the plaza. The manager did chase us down and apologized (which was definitely appreciated and warranted) but we had a movie to catch and were not happy, it was too late. This is the 1st time I have ever walked out of a restaurant, it was the 2nd time we had a huge issue with service. I do not think we will be back, we waited a long time between our last disappointment and this time and were let down again. Again,we understand things happen but I can tell you that one of the 1st tings I learned in every restaurant I ever worked in is, patrons should be greeted in some capacity as quickly as possible (within 3 minutes).  Perhaps this is one reason they had no wait while their competitor had 1.5 hours.

J2tMceTNBZT4edTBz5cOLw.text: I would've given this place 5 stars because the food was probably the best Mexican food I'd ever eaten but the service wasn't up to par.  Granted that we went during the Queen's Feast, which we totally forgot that it was going on.  I've worked in many restaurants and have also worked in a nice restaurant that participated in Charlotte's Queen's Feast and I know how busy you are but I also know that you shouldn't make your guest feel rushed ESPECIALLY since you didn't spiel the Queen's Feast specials to them and they ordered off the regular menu.  My boyfriend, daughter, and my baby went and waited for 1.5 hours (we were told before hand that the wait would be 45 min!)to be seated.  The hostesses were nice and we didn't mind waiting but with two kids that was quite a long time considering we were going to eat at the Firebirds next door but decided on a different restaurant because they told us the wait would be less. Any way, once seated our server was a male and right off the bat I can tell he was rushing us, my boyfriend asked if there were any specials and he told us they didn't for that day.  Never once did he informed us that it was Queen's Feast and the restaurant was featuring a menu for the event.  He got us our appetizers and our entree's (very quickly)  and everything was delicious.  I got the Frontier Fajita with Chicken and Steak, it was probably the best Fajita dish I've ever eaten and it came with all the condiments I would have wanted to add to my Fajita.  The seasoning was perfect and the portions was excessive.  My boyfriend got the Barbacoa dish and he is a big fan of Barbacoa, he said that was the most delish dish of Barbacoa he's had.  My daughter had the kids dish, Chicken Quesadilla and fries, she really enjoyed her dinner. We didn't finish most of our foods and asked for to go boxes. The server came by a few times to see how  things were going, he offered to box up our food for us.  I knew he was probably busy and weeded and was unsure if I wanted him to box our food up but my boyfriend said "yes".  I was still eating so he boxed up my boyfriend's dish, my daughter's, and our appetizers. My baby needed his little hands washed so I left with my daughter to go to the bathroom, When I came back, my food was gone, I assumed our server boxed it up for me while I was gone. We ordered the Quatro Leches cake and it was divine. It was perfectly made, very buttery and moist with I'm guessing is a marshmellow type topping that's slightly browned on top. My boyfriend went ahead and paid for our dinner and I have to say, it certainly didn't hurt our wallet!  Great food for a great price. My boyfriend asked if ALL the food was in the bag and the server said yes so we didn't question it. But before my boyfriend can even eat a bite of our dessert, our server came back and asked if he can box up the dessert, my boyfriend's response was "umm no, I'm still eating".  I know you are busy but you as a server still need to ensure your guest have a good dining experience. I was ready to go at that point ,  We left Cantina and went home. When we got home and checked our food, our server did not box up my fajita. The food was also just thrown in the box. I was very disappointed as I really didn't get to eat too much with having to take care of my 8 mth old. I was really looking forward to finishing my dinner at home! There was a lot left too....so I was a sad bunny with no fajita. I had to make me some noodles instead!  So over all, I like the restaurant and love the food, but...the service could've been better,  And I know its restaurant week but your service should never be less. We left a good tip too...we always do.  We will be going back and hopefully the service will be better. :)

m9d0m-ZLy7RiAVreQcy8Yg.text: I live near this place and have been here several times.  It's not the best Mexican food in town, but its consistently good.  I've had the enchiladas with red sauce and all the tacos. The fish tacos aren't amazing, but are decent.  The chicken is good as is the pork.  Other people at my table had the fajitas and burritos and everyone left happy.  We got the table-side guacamole too and that was pretty good.  The margaritas are good quality even with the house tequila.  So overall its somewhere around a 3 or 4.  I gave it a 4 just because I feel its better than average. I don't think you'll be overwhelmed, but not disappointed either.  Its fine for kids and groups.  May be a wait on weekends as lots of people go here pre-movie theater.

GIpWOps38RCBtBgPw1ghCg.text: Not worth the time let alone the money... Given I live close by I was really routing for the place and even went twice. Second chance was just as disappointing as the first.

e9ZmTHdWGxwdvSra5GbVlQ.text: From my other reviews perhaps you can tell I'm big into atmosphere. This place is beautiful. There were plenty of spots open at the bar so my friend and I sat near this amazing wall of wine and assorted accents. It was nice and dark and our table was lit by an oil candle. Our server was amazing. The guac alone is worth the trip! I've taken away one star because the main course wasn't great. I had the regular chicken enchilladas. My friend's food looked good but the rice and beans is more like beans and beans. And more beans.

s0wP-iBnlfOpCGsqc6iqnQ.text: After discussing lunch plans and deciding that we were  long overdue for some Mexican food my girlfriend and I decided to give Cantina 1511 a try.  For starters, the hostess sat us in a relatively unoccupied section and then sat subsequent patrons right next to us.  Although we were seated before the party next to us they got waited on first.  A few minutes later, Tim, our waiter materializes to taken our order.  Tim did take the time to help us navigate the menu and pointed out the main categories which was helpful.  After careful consideration, I ordered the two tacos - a carnes asada and whatever the duck one is called.  My girlfriend ordered the Enchiladas Verde.  Interestingly enough,  the fresh-made-to-order food came out not even 10 minutes after we ordered.  We barely had time to enjoy the greasy and over-salted chips that tasted of old cooking oil and salsa that tasted slightly worse than Old El Paso.  My girlfriend's entree arrives on a skillet with a pile of something under a pool of runny cheese and a another plate with two pitiful looking soft tacos (my entree).  We had both ordered black beans which were void of any real flavor and a complete disappointment (don't get me started on the Charro beans).  A minute or two into digging into her meal, my girlfriend realizes that there's chicken in her enchiladas.  We soon figured out she had been given the wrong entree.  Despite the mistake, the entree tasted like something you might get at a Senior's Center on Mexican food night. Thankfully she is no longer vegetarian.  We quickly flagged down the waiter and explained the mistake.  He said he would check with the kitchen but then showed up a few minutes later with our check.  Needless to say, we'll not be giving this place a second chance.

U2T0oNck60GETnCT_-MeDg.text: Guacamole is always delicious.  A True must get!!  The fish taco's were ok a bit too fishy for me.  Kids meal was not impressed have taken my kids there before and they loved it the chicken taco had a little chicken no lettuce, tomato or cheese or beans a bit disappointing.

gFlvitJ5ID57i-8LYG2RKg.text: Good food (chicken chichanga rocked), good atmosphere, nice servers, overall a good experience. A tad high in price and don't expect a huge portion but the taste and quality are excellent.  You won't be disappointed.

9TuiqXQMMuislprk2G48Pw.text: This is one of my friends' favorite restaurant because she cannot eat flower or sugar in her special diet and they offer her a pretty good selection. Thus, we have been here a couple of times before. Today was a perfect day for us to eat outside in their patio but I was alittle disappointed in the service becaue the server seemed a little out of it and it took him some time to take our order. The inside of restaurant is a little dark and noisy for me at times but the setting is, after all, more bar and grill. We always order the  Top Shelf Guacamole where they make it fresh in front of you. Normally it is very good but today it was a little salty. You really don't need to order this as an appetizer because their complementary chips and salsa are great and addicting by itself. I had the Tacos Marco Polo which is shrimp, jalapeno bacon and caramelized rajas with pico de gallo, and melted cheese served with tomato saffron rice and black beans (I did not have the cheese nor the beans). The taste was wonderful as evidenced by me finishing both tacos and half of the rice. It was a little pricey for two tacos though ($11.00). My friend ordered the Cantina Nachos for $8, which she said was a good deal for a huge portion of chips with chicken, onions, peppers, black beans served with pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole. . . it did not look appetizing to me but she said she liked (although she did not finish much of it). I am sure we will be back but it's not on the top of my favorite food list.

kOI7iDT1VkeXWPrAqG-sKg.text: My favorite Mexican spot in town. Yes, I realize it's more of a Mexican-fusion restaurant, but stick to the authentic Mexican items and you can get a killer meal for a reasonable price. Their chips and salsa are some of the best I've ever had and the barbacoa de puerco is my favorite.

RvoI8qOZC1t_HEmWtf0LlQ.text: I'm a big fan of Cantina 1511! The food is delicious, the staff is attentive, and the prices aren't too shabby. The guacamole is made fresh right in front of you which I'm a huge fan of. It is a about $10 so I would say it's good to share with others since you will have plenty of leftovers. I would definitly recommend this place.

Lce-0KO5Zb_Gu_UCiQzK8Q.text: Definitely overpriced for what it is.  I had been to the Dilworth location before and really enjoyed it. This time i had a Creative Loafing deal and decided to try the Stonecrest location. I was definitely underwhelmed. We had a reservation for 7:00. When we arrived we were promptly seated. I immediately felt like i was at Chuck E Cheese or Red Robin. Kids Galore!! So much for date night. Our tables were so close together it was a little uncomfortable.   We ordered the Fajitas for two with Steak and Beef. The little tapas they brought out were pretty tasty. The fajitas were a little overpriced in my opinion. We maybe had 10 pieces of chicken on a platter of zucchini, onions and mushrooms. $30 for some veggies is a little crazy.   I would maybe go back but not likely.

D9Zv552VJdi-RIbr5SpYfw.text: Food here is very good, about as authentic as your going to find in Charlotte. Try the tacos (the al pastor is pretty good) and the agua fresca.

SaS1Q6lecjTaLUsX3_aCMA.text: Maybe they were having an off night? Chips were not that great and the sauce on the enchiladas verdes was very different tasting. Love their guacamole though so I would give them another shot.

m3UFtZRqXR6cGmoZ4agYWQ.text: This was my 3rd time to Cantina.  The first two visits were decent, but I thought a bit overpriced. My third trip was a dissapointment.  I brought out of town family. 3 of us ordered the Barbacoa - which was highly recommended by our server. I thought the meat was very salty. I was surprised when my other 2 family members who love salt said the same thing.  Then I knew it wasn't my imagination.  We made mention to our server and she apologized.   My margarita was heavy on the sour mix and not terribly authentic.  For the price, there are many other lower priced options in the area.

5CO5F4_AUQ8CP7QugSCP3w.text: 30 minute wait on a Friday turned into 90.  I'm not saying that is something i don't expect on a busy weekend night, but if it's 90, tell me 90 or something close to it.  I walked over to a Wendy's and ate a hamburger so i didn't expire during the wait.  Service was good, food was excellent and fresh Mexican fare. The margarita flight special at 15.00 dollars equates to a 21oz margarita. Not a great deal and a bit showy for my taste. Variety is the spice, but I can do one margarita at a time if it costs half as much.

Qp2wWzyHibS7d9Qc6wMSKw.text: If you are in the mood for Mexican this is NOT the place for you!  Sure they have margarita's and even a few Spanish words on the menu but that is really where the similarities end.  I was there on a Saturday night and the place was busy, so that could be why the service was brutal- we had to ask for things multiple times before they came and the waitress wasn't familiar with the bar or even the menu.  As for the food I ordered a chimichunga it was okay but I wouldn't order it again.  It was as if they are trying too hard to make it different, if that's the case the succeeded.  However, I think they should have focused on making it better.

oi1gDavG4c6oMrmq_bZCzg.text: Not realizing that you cna make reservations we walked in and they said it was a 1hr 20 min wait so we sat at the bar which took less than 5 mins to find an empty table. If you go be sure to make a reservation or call ahead. I ordered the shredded pork dish and the other person ordered the shrimp taco. Both dishes were good and a lot, I ate maybe 1/2 of mine and so did the person I was with. The prices are good for the amount of food you get. It's the drinks that are pricey! We had ordered 2 of the margarita flight specials which we only liked 1 of the 3. I agree with Brett R.'s review, for $15 you're better off getting a full drink.

_zCxJqKmerDK4_MdC8iq-g.text: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Their guacamole made table side is always a staple along with a fresh margarita to wash it down. They always seem to have at least one nightly special to overwhelm your taste buds. Tonight I had the flash fried tuna tacos with avocado and tomatillo sauce which were amazing. Highly recommend the tacos Marco polo or the barbacoa as well. I always leave with a full belly but never seem to have room for dessert.

RtzQfoLqZOYt0FqicGQucQ.text: Pretty good Mexican food for the area.  We've been many times and have never been disappointed in what we ordered.  The table side guacamole is awesome and worth it every time!  Service has been friendly for the most part as well.

SPQnw8Vd9d-ZIP_oTomPzQ.text: My mom is a Mexican Chef and took her to Cantina in 2012 and she absolutely loved it! We went there a couple of times, but then I stopped going for a few months. Apparently they changed ownership and I visited the restaurant with my husband again a couple of weeks ago. It was a waste of our time and calories. The only good thing was the service. The chips tasted old and their red salsa tasted like everyone else's, straight out of the bottle. I read that their green salsa was incredible, so I ordered it, and it was a shame! It tasted straight out of the bottle too. I am Mexican, I would know! I ordered a burrito and it was okay, nothing out of the ordinary as it used to be. Definitely not worth my trip to this place, when I can most likely find fresher food with more taste at some spot down central avenue. I wasn't looking for authentic, I know that is hard to find, but I was looking for quality food that is unique in taste and savory. Not coming back again!

uL2Rb_CIVHm9qul_JGU3ig.text: Quacamole not your favorite?  IT WILL  BE HERE!!!!  I enjoy excellent "real mexican food in the southwest" This place comes very close on their "authentic mexican food items". They might even be a little more tasty. Pork Carnitas with Habernero and Guac sauce. UNREAL! Not too spicy promise! Order it! Hands down one of the best pulled pork carnitas I have EVER had!  Excellent Food, Excellent service! Well Done and Yum!

rRE7EJEgscCHAgvsUpxzrQ.text: Love this place for family night out, date night or what ever night. Everything here tastes fresh and has great flavor.  I am a fan of the tacos. Every time I visit I have intentions of ordering something new but the Tacos call me and I cannot resist them. The Tacos al Pastor, Carnitas Johnny, Carne Asada Steak I drizzle a little lime over them and I get so happy. My wife loves the Barbacoa de Puerco and we both love the Margaritas. What makes this place easy for us is the kids meals my twin 5 year olds find something on the menu each time that they will eat and love. I as a parent can feel good that they are getting a real meal. We can have a nice meal and everyone can find something they love to eat.

LD14SkjGXP7jBwA6OQG-hg.text: Wow!  Really great food!  1511 serves both authentic Mexican and Tex-Mex style food.  The Barbacoa de Puerco is amazing.  My fiance and I split the dinner size and it was more than enough.  We have also had the cuatro leches and enchilladas de Dennis...they are both wonderful as well.  The atmosphere is great and they offer every tequila you can imagine!  They have regular beer specials as well.  This place is a winner!!!

F6mb6iHTIxtP3p4-8bzVlQ.text: Just had lunch there and sat at the bar. Bartender was awesome! The food was outstanding! My first time there and I had the chicken chimichanga......best I have ever had! Great prices too! Manager was awesome too.....made sure everything was great and gave me an appetizer card for their table side guacamole for my next visit! I highly recommend this restaurant!

eCpGSQIcMaDovMlDCeow8Q.text: I love this place.  So does my wife.  Music can be a bit loud but who cares im here to eat...  My wife always get the guacamole and she loves it.  i love the queso fundido and basically anything else on the menu.  I HAVE NEVER HAD A BAD MEAL HERE.

oCy_7WGWwcDFqG7SPiRVWQ.text: My workmates love this place - or at least we somehow keep going here. The food is tasty enough for what it is and I'm ok with the prices, but the service in the bar area is HORRIBLE. Hoping management reads yelp since the people at the bar are friendly but horribly inefficient and even though you've staffed sufficinently, it doesn't help if there are lots of customers and your team members are standing around chatting with each other, completely obivious to customers in this economy who want to spend money.

T_6GTuG57PznWAYWVFp0TQ.text: I have to say that I don't know much about Mexican food but I loooove Cantina! Only recently has their quac been pushed aside for the Number One position by Loco Lime. But it is still top notch. The fish taco appetizer is more than enough food for dinner! Great serving sizes no matter what you get. You can definitely split the fajitas since a single order is ginormous. The staff here is always super pleasant and helpful. I have been both to the Rea Road location and East and have to say quality and atmosphere and staff-friendliness is consistently excellent! Love the patio on East blvd location during the summer :-D

JqGoAZnIu5LVLdtOm-_u_Q.text: Awful experience. Bar area smelled of damp dirty towels and bar top wasnt cleaned but sticky with old salsa. Gross

zoEGKb2nRTt8xnAlpp8A-A.text: Taco Bell is better. Taco fell apart. Had to eat without shell. No seasoning on beans and rice. Would not recommend

mMuQXLkEFYVJeps0m3XxtQ.text: My boyfriend and I come to Cantina often just to sit down and have their fresh tableside guac! Their food and service is always spot on and we never leave disappointed or hungry

OHQRTlm-7ZHLGumdzpOOLw.text: I finally came back to try some food. Verdict: No. Unless you enjoy overpriced plantains.  Crab quesadilla. How do you mess that up? Flavorless. Dull. Not a whole lot of crab.  They are super super NOT accommodating to food allergies.   Waiter walked away as I was still speaking, so that's pretty awesome, too.  Was told that the plantains would be an upcharge to sub the side dish I was allergic to. What they didn't tell me was that they would simply omit the included side dish and charge me full price for the plantains.  I will never be back here. Poor food, poor customer service.  Also, some of our tableware was dirty, but the water who walked away never checked back on us, so we had to walk over to the bar and snag some clean ones.

oiwdcm1au7NiVwF-H6aZsA.text: Excellent service by Carly and the food was so very fresh and perfectly prepared. Well done Team Cantina 1511!!!

tNvBx4kXrqmuj2kDLVvi9w.text: Had a wonderful time celebrating my friend's birthday. The carne asada taco was delicious and the guacamole may be the best in Charlotte.

K5BPsIj5dIieuD6BEqMGeg.text: Came to celebrate my wife's birthday and was well treated. The service was prompt and courteous. The food was delicious. This has always been a good place to go to celebrate or even just to get out. Cantina 1511 is always a favorite.

UDYgYG26el4s7NS9sxQoZw.text: First time at Cantina Stonecrest. NOT GOOD. I ordered a chicken quesadilla and asked for shredded chicken. Waiter said they don't have shredded chicken. Ok what???? How do you not have shredded chicken? You just shred the chicken....I'm not sure what the disconnect was. Waiter brought out my plate...no shredded chicken and no conversation about it. I made a smart comment and the waiter didn't say a word. We also had two people there celebrating birthdays....one of our guests asked when we got there to have someone come to sing happy birthday for two of our guests...never happened.   This place sucks, food sucked and WAY overpriced. The quesadilla that I got at Cantina was $14.95....it costs $5-6 at other mexican places and tastes so much better.   Will not return

cangW3IXczNMeq0F6UE8WA.text: My fiance and I LOVE Cantina 1511! You can always count on the food being great. I always get the shrimp P.O. boy tacos. They're fantastic! The service can't be beat either. If you have room for dessert, make sure to get the Quatros Leches! We're moving away and trying to get as much Cantina as we can before we go!

960sllgIBizvh3Z0IvqgzA.text: Always love going to cantina for a great meal at a great price. Guacamole is the best and the quesadillas.

tnr2g--K7YbeilOtrtmtBg.text: The food is just ok. The drinks are the only reason to go in my book. The blood orange margarita is amazing. I have tried several things but not hit has ever been outstanding there.

Rwpo7rdOLC9mzyZr0e1jVw.text: I have been here a few times and have never had a worse experience than I did today. We waited an hour for our food (at lunch), had no chip refills (we ordered guacamole and queso) and no drink refills. We paid for our food before it even came out and when I brought all of this to the attention of the manager he said he 'would give a few of the girls free guacamole coupons'. Needless to say, I was less than impressed and would rather go to one of the twenty other restaurants in the area for lunch in the future.   Oh and there was no apology for the terrible service and timing.

16ui2XFjBTGB0aR_0ZmwCA.text: A girlfriend and I were trying to catch a movie after work, but we had some time before and decided to give this place a try. I'd read mixed reviews about this place was I'll admit I was a bit skeptical trying this place but I was actually very pleased with my visit.   We arrived a little before 6pm and the place wasn't too packed, we were seated immediately and our waiter was prompt and attentive. The chips and salsa arrived first. The chips were warm...always a good sign! And the salsa was good too! It wasn't too chunky or full of cilantro it was delicious! We practically inhaled the first basket!    I decided to try the S'Western Nachos with chicken. The nachos come topped with your choice of chicken or beef and black beans, queso, caramelized onions, sour cream, guacamole and cheese. I ordered the half size portion but it was MORE than enough for a good meal. They added a lot of chicken, almost every bite I had included some chicken. I loved them! I would absolutely order them again....but next time with a margarita because I'll have more time!   I'm going to have to go back and try something else off the menu but so far they win my approval.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nachos

QBwKf4WPrWJaRY5VUOegwQ.text: Yeah... No....  the only good thing about it were drinks. Mexican food? I don't think so.

b9tlQRxj4haNODSjALCHtQ.text: I enjoyed my time in Charlotte visiting a friend. I suggested Mexican and without blinking, her first option was Cantina 1511. From servers to cost to drinks and guac I give them 5 out 5! I'll mos def be returning in future.

vGjeIvFq-ZmBEwpSrPkPCQ.text: We went  right before they were closing and ordered take out from the bar. The bartender was nice and attentive, and even though they were closing he still took time to explain options. My drink was good and I didn't feel rushed. I would definitely return because of the service alone. I ordered Tacos, they were okay, I want to try them again dining in hopefully they are better.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

l4NMi1gv8dCsBKlfTPrhog.text: Our group was accosted by the manager who continued to escalate the situation to the point of making everyone in the room feel very uncomfortable.  We had a very large group of 26 and rented out the private room for a birthday party.  After dinner everyone asked for their tabs and absolute confusion among the wait staff ensued for over 20 minutes.  They were asking everyone what they had and it was crystal clear that something had gone wrong with their ticketing system or ability to operate it correctly.  Everyone grew impatient and as tabs were brought out in waves (in some cases 1 by 1) people were asked if it looked correct to them or if they saw any mistakes.  Those that felt their bill was correct then settled up and exited as it was late and many in the group had baby sitters at home waiting on them.  As one of the last remaining couples, my wife and I were finally handed our bill.  We gave our card and while we were waiting for our card to be processed the manager made his first appearance of the night.  He approached the group and let everyone know that there was $40 in random food and drinks that hadn't been claimed and gave an ultimatum that someone pay it or it would be added to the minimum requirement ($800 required to reserve the private room) which everyone knew would fall on the husband of the birthday girl as he had made the reservation.  Immediately and without argument the birthday girl's husband stepped right up and said "no problem, I got it" as he took the marginal check and signed it.  At this point several couples felt offended by the way in which the manager approached the group, it was as if he was accusing us of stealing.  We began to let the manager know that in fact everyone had happily worked with the staff through what we deemed to be a blunder on their part and tried to make the best of a bad situation.  He took great offense to this and said that in fact it was our fault for everyone not remembering what they had. Our group had been waiting for close to 30 minutes to cash out at this point and no one was in the mood to be accosted and talked down to.  The back and forth escalated with the manager becoming more and more standoffish until finally when you could cut the tension in the room with a knife, his wait staff stepped in to intervene by physically stepping between him and our group (who were all still seated) and pointing out that we had already paid his $40 demand.  I have never in my life witnessed a company representative behave in this way and many in the group, especially the women, felt threatened and intimidated.  It is also worth noting that the sum of the bills among 4 of the last remaining couples totaled over $500 so it is hard for me to believe that the sum of the other 9 couples bills totaled less than $300 to meet the minimum.

dnIgEoNGv13QDVnBsvL_OA.text: I was surprised to see the wide range of reviews on this place. It's not your typical Tex-Mex restaurant. It's an upscale restaurant in an upscale shopping center. If you are looking for a cheese enchilada and a ground beef taco, this is not your place. Excellent and adventuresome menu. We LOVED everything we tried!  But get at least one dish that includes their shrimp. Best I have ever had anywhere, including NOLA!  Do yourself a favor and get a Papa Grande Margarita.  This was recommended to us by our very fun waiter, Max. We had a delightful meal and drinks and will be back. You should give them a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Off the hook traditional and shrimp taco&#39;s!

GFcO5KVeOQh0kCPaOKJ8qw.text: Although we have been to this location of Cantina many, many times, this is my first actual review.  Always great food, the tacos are larger and more flavorful than many spots... Service has improved over time.  We prefer to sit on the "bar" side as we like the atmosphere and seeing the tvs.  Tuesdays is "kids night" which is amazing...Kids eat FREE!   Cantina is our ONLY choice for Mexican.  Highly recommend!

EJWNKYSAimDYywD6-hRgLQ.text: Amazing Saturday Night here! Gets busy so make sure you set time aside for waiting. Chicken Fajitas we're excellent, as well as the quesadilla. Great service by Hesham!!!. He was so friendly, and kept in touch even though he was extremely busy. His personality was top notch as well. Please courteous to servers during busy nights. They are moving as fast as they can. We we're very, very pleased, and will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. A quick photo of inside.

2SuG0IutL-Ubp-4oYgkzFg.text: The food was just okay to begin with and it has steadily declined over the past few months. My favorite dish used to be the enchiladas rojas (beef enchiladas). Well they changed the way that these are cooked, now they are just cheese enchiladas with a beef topping on top. Doesn't taste the same.

f4cPEo1lXIcDRcijA2pdrw.text: Sat at the bar last night with my hubby for drinks and apps and everything was great! They make amazing margaritas and the nachos were outstanding!

tZQ4Q9KdJQRm_39ZQNcmwA.text: I loved this place. Super nice inside, great service. Loved the food! Had a Marco Polo taco (sooo good!!) and a grilled mushroom taco, also so good! Overall great food, clean and nice. Definitely will be back.

0efNN0xZAxj77fQgnCDQVA.text: A little out of the ordinary for (American) Mexican-style cuisine, which I find enjoyable. I've eaten here numerous times, and the service is typically terrific, as is the food. I'm especially fond of the Ancho Pollo tacos, as well as the Tejas tacos, which can both be prepared gluten free--a very happy thing for me and my health needs.

ukF7sxx347zTjL8IvxgucA.text: First off I need to stay the service is awesome and the waiters are very nice. The gluten free menu is why we went. Daughter has Celiacs and the staff is trained and the menu is very well done in regards to gluten. that's is the only reason they get 2 stars. Im not going back however.  O.k. down to the food. Its awful, the food is OVER SALTED, its plain salty. The chips salty, the queso has to many sweet onions that overtake it, same with the stake quesadia,  the burrito and tacos are non edible. I ordered the steak burrito and did not eat it. picked the meat out, packet with undercooked rice and stale cold tortilla.. My wife ordered the enchiladas swissa verde and the chicken was boiled and dried out. It had a disgusting taste to it. I tried to take a bite but the smell made me gag.The beans are undercooked and so is the rice I'm sure to the casual chain eating diner they may be o.k. with this place but if your a foodie. stay clear. Oh and the beer is really cold which they got right. Summary staff great, food awful, beer cold.

0QHMgQNM1zl40ZvsoSxBFw.text: Best fajitas and burritos! My girlfriend and I love Cantina for Sunday lunch! Great margarita made with fresh juice! We like to sit in the bar so we can watch football.

jYV4xBjymBXtSJvIQKqx9Q.text: Margarita please!  I like this place!  Service is good, food is good, margaritas are great!  I love that the skinny margaritas aren't full of fake sweeteners but literally a smaller version of the regular.  The guacamole is tableside and good but make sure they don't try to put unripened avocados in there... They've tried it once.  I just love the mushroom tacos.  A nice fresh spin on veggie tacos.  The outdoor seating is nice a spacious and quiet during the day if you need to get some work done!  The salads are tasty too... Jicama makes everything taste better imo...  Still my go to spot in stonecrest... Keep up the good work

YyUK3LYJt8V7x5pDHJOUBg.text: I need to get here more often. They've added some things to the menu but I keep ordering the same thing because I don't go here enough. My go-to is the Tacos Marco Polo with shrimp, jalapeno, and bacon. The table-side guacamole is delish. Next time I'll try the guac sampler. They've also added a family style option for at least two people that we will try next time around.

zWVk3si5yYdN19rMkagG7A.text: Food is ok, questionable management brooms and dust pans left out near patrons tables. Very unusual manager and wait staff just walk by it, I guess I'm glad there isn't a mop bucket or toilet plunger...

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

mPURUegiznLqOWVbMK_rvQ.text: They are now doing brunch on Saturdays & Sundays. The "Avocado Bake"  is absolutely the best brunch item I have ever consumed! YUM!    The last time we were there, the portions were less than we thought they should have been;   this time there was enough food per entree to share. Our server was very attentive, polite and eager to have us enjoy our dining experience.  Go get brunch at Cantina 1511 on Rea Rd. !!

S5Re7f3Zau0dPhmpLQVP6g.text: Awful service. My wife and I used to come here for lunch once or twice a month a few years ago and the service was better. Now we have been back twice recently and both times (different servers) were frustrating to say the least. The first time was last week- my mother in law's wine took about 20 minutes to get to us despite the waitress saying there were no customers at the bar. The queso dip we ordered also took about 20-25 minutes to get to our table. Only one person received water at our table. Our entrees took an abnormally long time to get to us. I understand it's not necessarily the waitress' fault but she made excuses for everything and long drawn out ones. Basically everything took forever and we were left at our table without water or refills on salsa, beer and wine for extremely long periods of time. We all left complaining how disorganized and frustrating the experience was. The waitress did convince the manager to take off our queso from the bill which we appreciated but it would have made us feel a lot better about the situation had the manager come to speak to us about it as well.   Then today my wife and I decided to give it another try as we used to like the chopped salad as a lunch option and we thought maybe they had just been having an off day before. My wife ordered an Unsweet tea, the young waiter brought her a sweet tea. It took him a while to come back to the table. We both ordered the soup and salad combo. They got hers right this time but I only got a salad, no soup. We were both clear on what we wanted but it just didn't seem like the waiter was "all there". Like he was tired and unfocused and didn't want to be there. He also forgot our refill of salsa. When we were done with our meal it took forever for anyone to come check on us. We were sitting there with our food pushed away ready to get the check. The manager even peaked at us and saw us sitting there but still no one came. Finally we got the check and couldn't wait to get out of there because it took so long.  The food is decent here but it really does feel like there is an issue with the management that trickles down to the lack of urgency and quality of service with the waiters. The staff acts like they don't really care that much even when it's not busy. The overall sense of service in this restaurant is not good. There needs to be more management and accountability with the staff.

xn3QaNmdGluTljczsCiXIA.text: Great customer service.  Called to make reservation for future and told to call back another day because they are busy tonight  Manager followed up.

I4HDW1Y4t4ywQl-JLnM9Bg.text: Great food and great service! I ordered the Thai shrimp tacos and the portobello mushroom tacos. My husband had some shrimp enchiladas that he really enjoyed. We started with the queso which is amazing and addicting. Complimentary chips and salsa, and the salsa is very fresh and delicious. Definitely the best either of us has ever had! We will definitely be back.

VOMAjX5dPFjNzhHu6ocmrQ.text: Went here on a Saturday night for dinner. The menu looked great but the service was disappointing. The drinks and food took a long time and the waitstaff wasn't attentive. They brought the wrong food out and were very slow on drink refills.  The ambience is great especially outside and the live music was great. The staff was good about taking the wrong food off the bill and was accommodating. I'd recommend going on a week night and maybe service would be better when it's less crowded

tB7oOHdxyyz9zzMw-WpeiA.text: Don't come here with a party larger than 5. We were here for a dinner, with a party of 15. We arrived here at 7pm were sat, and our waiter took care of our drinks. Unfortunately, I believe it was also our waiters first table of a vast size. After sitting for about an hour, our meal orders were taken, and they came out in a greater than timely manner. Then we ate.....and played the waiting game. Our poor waiter was left to himself to divy up the checks (spilt between 5, all seated in order and not changing). He came back with our checks, which were not split correctly, besides one couples. Then, that couple paid (over $100), and the manger came and said it was confusing and wanted to split the rest of the check between everyone, at $25 each. This did not appease anyone, especially the people whose meals were less than $10. Finally, after about 45 minutes of trying to figure this out, the manager FINALLY came out and made us retell our orders one by one. This was a whole ordeal at a table full of previous servers that could have been easily avoided.   Additionally, the food, it was just sub-par (will give props to the table side guacamole).   Overall, there are plenty of different restaurants in this complex or other Mexican restaurants in the area to satisfy your craving.

nWeIFh4q_t6MlUKkpyiFFQ.text: In the last year in a half, I've noticed a marked decrease in quality at both the Dilworth and Stonecrest restaurants.  At Stonecrest, our cold sides for fajitas were put under a heat lamp and the lettuce was all burnt.  Who does that???  The other thing I noticed, at both locations, they prepped the plates way in advance of the main dish and stuck it under a heat lamp until the main dish was ready.  The top of my beans were singed.  This is on more than one occasion, too.  The heat lamp appears to be akin to a microwave in a bad restaurant here.  In Europe, they bring each dish out when it's ready so no heat lamp is necessary.  I wish we'd be more like that in the US rather than trying to hold up dishes to serve altogether.  It rarely works.  Someone's dish is going to be subpar doing it that way.  The last time we ate there, so many things were wrong, we complained to the mgr.  We are generally not complainers.  I will say the management made it right.  They comp'd the entire meal.  However, we've struggled to have the desire to go back - we even have a 50% off coupon to use!!!  At Dilworth, the wattage in the pendant lighting was so bright we were squinting the entire time (not joking.)  We even sent an "anonymous text message to the manager" about it.  It was horrible.  Also, the music was so loud, we were practically screaming at each other.  Restaurants, please, if you have to scream to hear yourselves talk to each other, the music is TOO LOUD!  I'm not an old fuddyduddy.  I enjoy some good ambient music, too, but it's not a freaking disco!  It's too bad the quality of the food and atmosphere has decreased.  It used to be my favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  Now the desire to return escapes me.

ukMOFqNjlcMFOkl-brDPrQ.text: I went here for a girls night out. I was pretty surprised at how expensive it is. $15 for 3 tacos?!? Which might have been acceptable if the tacos had been exceptional. They were rather Bland and not very interesting at all. Big disappointment.

1KDOW1ZuYLZ9_9j_ddmP-Q.text: My purpose in this post (my first ever) is to comment on their ability to run an event.  Jennifer Gallagher, event coordinator for the group, ran a bridal shower for me this month (July).... She is thorough, she is professional and she delivers. There are no surprises. She stayed (in the background) during the entire 3 hour event.

-1H6GiA2vStXE_cYOokHRg.text: Have you ever had a manager bring back the meal you sent back and argue with you over the reason? Neither have I until last night! We were there to celebrate a birthday, two people ordered the crab and avocado quesadillas without bacon. One order came out perfect, the second did not have one piece of crabmeat in the quesadilla. Politely tell the server whose response is, 'I'm so sorry, the kitchen is killing me tonight. I'll be back with a new one.' A new meal is delivered BUT it now has bacon in it... the server again apologizes, says we will not be charged for this meal. We ask for it to be wrapped up to go as everyone else was finished with their meal by now. The manager comes out not to apologize or deliver the new order but to show us 3 opened quesadillas to argue about the existence of bacon! After many words about her lack of customer service or managerial skills, not only were we not offered dessert to celebrate the reason we were even there, we were promptly delivered our checks. NEVER GOING BACK! The manager on duty was named Stephanie although I can't imagine her holding that position long... there are so many options in the area for great Mexican food, avoid this restaurant at all costs. It was the Stonecrest location. On a more pleasant note, we then went next door to Firebirds, had an amazing server, great drinks and dessert. After discussing with her what happened next door at Cantina, she brought our birthday girl another dessert on the house to take home with her. THAT'S CUSTOMER SERVICE, THATS HOW YOU CREATE A RAVING FAN! Not only will I tell everyone I know about the horror of Cantina, I'll also be singing the praises of Firebirds and Victoria. Go see her, she works Saturday evenings - amazing customer service!

-33cDD1PCIoLgIkqHeJiAA.text: I am pretty picky about guacamole, but I do enjoy their tableside guac. Only complaint is that sometimes I would like a little more bite & a little more tomato in mine.  The chips are always fresh & salsa is tasty.   The last couple of visits, I ended up getting a ginormous salad with iceberg & romaine letttuce, diced chicken, tomatoes, jimaca,  black beans, garbanzos, guacamole, tostado shells, etc.     Did I mention how ginormous this salad is?  Seriously, it is huge  & I cannot eat it all.   I also enjoy their enchiladas here...although, they recently changed the menu and I can no longer get my fav enchilada so that was a bit of a bummer. Oh well, plenty of other options here, so it's not a deal breaker.   On our last couple of visits, our service has been fast and friendly.

UrpIo_-MZTB94qT7U2_50w.text: WHY ???  did you change the chips?????    So disappointed last night.  We went to Cantina instead of On the Border just because of the chips and salsa. Now you've gone and changed the chips.  The old ones were better!!!!!!   Please change back.

619IIf7dUex7biFvJ7c1_w.text: I've eaten here three times and found it to be average at best and greatly overpriced. The complimentary chips and salsa was excellent however. The chips were thin, fresh and tasty.   Ordered the chimichanga twice and it was large and nicely prepared but $13.95?! Come on! The enchiladas were okay and priced at $8 for two and $12 for three. Service was acceptable and atmosphere, attractive. Decent beer selections.  Still, there are better choices all around...

IfK7hA8CwmBL-rZlnXd-rg.text: Received a to go order with missing items and were pretty unimpressed with the manager, Bryan's response.  We have been pretty faithful customers for a long time but there are too many good options in the area to go where they don't seem to care.

9ReMF4oO_m_FgUzI0ut_Ag.text: This location is not the best. I ordered carry out and they said they could not accommodate my vegetarian order without mushrooms. After ordering for my family they rang me up then asked the kitchen for the order. When the order came out they had the audacity to ask did I pay. I ignored them when I got home I found out the order was wrong.

z8u2F6xsezJFPJBsog4S5A.text: I was really excited to learn about there skinny margaritas and the fresh made table side guacamole! My husband got salmon and potatoes and they where seasoned perfectly! I got the chicken burrito and it was ginormous! Chips and fresh salsa are served when you sit down.

QHCYpb1Wx-G8k7QdIaxlBQ.text: This place is way over priced and food taste terrible. Definitely don't get the cheese dip taste like cardboard.

4U_2LcVqYecBLf8VKWh4KQ.text: I hadn't been to Cantina 1511 in years and am disappointed to see how much it has changed.   Our waiter was a pain and did not want to tell my mom the price of the brisket that is no longer listed on the menu. After asking about 5 times and him constantly expressing his dissatisfaction with the restaurant taking it off the menu, he finally gave us an answer. My mom loved the brisket...she always does.   I ordered the guacamole as an appetizer and it was yummy. You can't really mess up table side guacamole since you can tell the waiter/waitress what to add. For my entree, I had the Crab and Avocado Quesadilla. Nothing special and it came with no sides. Although it isn't listed on the menu, the quesadillas come in two sizes (small and large). I think I got the small, but who knows.   Cantina 1511 used to be on my list of places to go every time I return to Charlotte but I think this will be my last time.

I3nnSBmzA6rB10ake5ENRg.text: Decent Mexican food! Have always had a good meal and good service when we've eaten here. I usually go for the 2-3 taco dinner. I've tried different ones every time and never been disappointed. Had a blood orange margarita last time and it was very good. The only weird thing I will say is their takeout option. You order then show up and the hostess directs you to this tiny computer next to the bar and right in front of the kitchen. It's extremely tight and you are in the servers way the entire time. Probably would make more sense for the hostess to get it? That's my only recommendation. We will likely eat here many more times due to it being walking distance from our house.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZjYU4MTmWtySA1hmy5KOWw.text: Cantina's food is awesome. I've never had anything I didn't like. Their salsa is some of the best. But the service at all 3 of their locations is consistently just bad and has just gotten worse... it's really a shame. We gave the Rea Rd location another try tonight and after receiving our drinks is styrofoam cups with lids (because the half full restaurant ran out of glasses(?)) and waiting about 30 minutes for our food after ordering, they still managed to get 2 of the 4 meals our party ordered wrong...  We've been here before where we've waited 30 minutes for our food only to be told the waiter forgot to put it into the system so he just submitted it and it'll only be a few more minutes... we've sat with empty water glasses for what feels like an eternity... had rude waiters that don't know their own menu or specials... the list goes on... it's honestly like the servers here have never eaten in a restaurant themselves and don't understand the level of service they should provide. Because at the end of the day, it's just not that hard... good service makes up for pretty much everything else that could go wrong...it's just so essential and so missing from these restaurants. But the food is good so what can I say? We're suckers and keep coming back hoping something has changed... but I think this may have been our last visit...

sUEuKHnUaCmpuOrXGg7HWw.text: Great food! A little pricey but worth it! I go here frequently and I'm always satisfied. Recommend if you are in the Ballantyne area looking for somewhere to eat.

PqdF2oQ1tETDOgffVJzYqQ.text: I've been to a few Cantinas around town and I always enjoy them. The funky tacos are innovative and tasty. Highly recommend the Thai shrimp tacos! Prices are right and service is friendly.

b91l7vCTK-95QeyGSfhXQA.text: Great service. Really friendly staff. Food is usually great. Great guacamole. Food came out really fast and very kid friendly!

u9freOJ4bBf4wzMiwHPcdg.text: Delish Guacamole, wonderful margarita...This is a great lunch spot. I recommend Tahona Margarita is a must, it's a one and done type.

e8X7f0oH9JPVCf5Sw6xPQg.text: Great food and good service! The table side guacamole and quest are two of our favorites!

Q1G0isU-neIssbwI3CXpVQ.text: Love coming here, especially for margs on the patio! Good food and friendly staff every time!

6YgP1IPw1742PReTisV4WA.text: This location of Cantina 1511 is my favorite.  All staff is wonderful and food never disappoints.  The only reason why gave it 4 stars is I signed up for cash back and used an appropriate card but never received cash back.  This what I hate about some of these apps.  Can you tell me what happened?  Yelp says deal is attached I paid with linked card.  No cash back?

PTD5zm-ob0Mec5RboHIYdw.text: The best Mexican food in Charlotte!  The service and food were exceptional. It was some of the best salsa we've had, and the enchiladas were very flavorful.

ulA-qiMnnkXSAYoj3gBvbQ.text: I do love Mexican food, and have been to various places all over the country.  I was disappointed with this restaurant.  The service was great--the food not so much.  We ordered Margaritas.  Everywhere I've pretty much have had a Margarita, it's Tequila, a triple sec or higher quality liquor like Cointreau or Grand Marnier, and lime juice.  They use orange juice, and that's all you could taste.  I ordered fajitas.  The platter was huge, but they only gave you three tortillas. Fajita should be simple--protein, onions and peppers.  The condiment plate had pickled carrots and onions that overtook the rest of the condiments.  They could simplify the dish, and it would be better.  My companions dish was inedible.  The manager was fantastic and offers a free desert.  We got the tres leche,  one of my favorites.  It would have been good, but they added marshmallows or fluff all over the top.  Again, service was good, food I wouldn't go back.

5NJ-yNj9gPhwUoMN-6-bsA.text: Great guacamole, not very authentic Mexican food but a great Mexican-American restaurant. Would recommend if this is what you're looking for. Also, their tres leches is off the chain.

9iSbQRK2Vw4vY8CET5B_kQ.text: Another nice meal at 1511. The red sangria and los 1511 marg hit the spot. The salsa and chips were excellent and our mains of chicken quesadillas and chicken enchiladas were tasty and well prepared.  The service was excellent as well.

LnOE5F1NPW7gV_QDV7QOzw.text: Waitress was new. She didn't know the menu. She was slow and didn't bring more than one drink at a time. Paid a lot of money to eat Taco Bell quality food

6OLSwMq_Cr2s4WzcHnvUkw.text: Just ordered take out from them tonight. They said it would be ready in 20-25 minutes and we literally live across the street so we were there at 20 minutes. The food must have been sitting for a while because the food was cold and needed to be reheated. The 'bowl' of soup had two small meatballs in it. The 'pint' container it came in was also not filled and was a good inch from the top. I called and the person who answered said it came with two meatballs and that was the right container. The other food was decent but we probably won't be going here again.
