3wR76C3Db10aWR6ph5xpcA.text: Wow I was sad I had to write a poor review for the resturant I had high hopes. First the atmosphere was nice,clean and relaxing. The service was great but the food was over the top salty. I love mexican food and I can eat it everyday but not here. I enjoyed the salsa but the chips were to salty the the dinner which was nachos it taste like I was eating nothing but salt. I am not sure why this was. I had to drink alot of water to flush out my body. Would I try again probably not I just had better and not worth the drive for me.

_f01GBITT6TNeNwJgL9pdg.text: The burrito was delicious and a huge portion.  Be careful not too eat too many chips before the meal because they will keep bring them!  Great atmosphere with love music outside on the weekend.  Can't wait to go back!

GMUWRlw54p4C0b2jIMIMwQ.text: Excellent food + excellent service = super duper satisfied couple!  We did want the table side guac and I ordered the 'Pollo Laredo' and wife ordered the 'Enchiladas De Dennis'. We were both very satisfied, al though I would have ordered something if I were her. We both have bit of a sweet tooth, so to end it all off nicely, we ordered the 'Cuatro leches'. Holy *%#&, we both LOVED the desert!  So, if you want good tex-mex in a casual, yet excellent service ambiance, then you have to go here.

2Th-DIv6bG7Sz3rdrqJ7hw.text: Service is slow. Management and staff seemed confused and if they had any personalities, they were hiding them from their guests. I had to ask three times from another round of drinks. The food came out after 35 minutes (some of the orders anyway). One was cold, one was fine, and the other order came out 10 minutes later after we asked about it twice. So I have to put this place in the "won't be back unless I have to" category. Also, the food is overpriced ... after all,  it's just mexican.

HKwsghV1au6V23GAMQPjVg.text: Lived here for three years and just discovered this place. Amazing!  I grew up in Los Angeles so I know good ethnic food.  WOW!!!

WHk2V9JdXhIbs55WomDXLA.text: Food was average at the best. I had the beef burrito and I would never order it again. We ordered the guacamole dip i wasn't that impressed. Also I thought overall pretty pricey place. Want be going back anytime soon.

hN5BQzx1SYpZNz5UwjNjng.text: Definitely overpriced for what it is.  I've eaten here a few times and the first couple were pretty delicious (LOVING that queso fundido) but the last time was so salty, I couldn't even eat. I sucked down tea like I'd never had a drink in my life just trying to put some moisture back into my tongue. With the over-salting and the high prices, I'd much rather go to another Mexican restaurant where it feels more authentic and rich, and where the food seems more genuine and tastes tons better.  Just wish I could take that queso fundido with me...  I will also say that if you happen to wander in late (a big no-no for me, but sometimes things happen) they won't turn you away and they serve you with the same courteous and friendly behavior as if it were the middle of the day. So kudos for that.

H4Qd2MP9f5raZ1ydZmpPGA.text: I enjoy their South of the Border nachos. For 6.99 you get a half order and it is enough for two people! I always need help finishing them, since they are piled high with yummy ingredients such as beef or chicken, guac and sour cream, cheese, pico, and more cheese! I also enjoy their assortment of cerviches! The enchiladas are all delicious, you will have a hard time choosing one. The tacos are good, and the barbacoa is divine!

WdhfY0Vi-hXb9SDl4vXdDA.text: To begin with, I don't understand Cantina 1511's apparent fetish for playing Mexican music at ear-bleeding sound levels. My wife and I were in one mid-week evening after the crowd had departed and were one of only a handful of tables occupied in the entire place. We literally could not hold a conversation sitting 90 degrees from one another at a square table. When we placed our order, we also asked that the music be turned down to a moderate level, and I swear our server was overjoyed to have an excuse to turn it down.  That said, the food was OK, not great. As transplanted Californians, perhaps our standard for "great" is a little higher than someone else's, but the food was serviceable. I just don't think it justified the prices charged. The brutal truth about Mexican food is that, for the staples (enchiladas, burritos, etc), the costs are minimal, the degree of difficulty in preparation is  minuscule, the time required to plate up an order shouldn't take 20-30 minutes, and it shouldn't cost $8 to $10.  That night, the service was rather prompt but other visits we have seen very slow service. And at all times, the damn music was just obnoxious.  I'd return, but only to sit outside, and not anytime soon. To those of you who love Cantina 1511, mazel tov. I'm happy for you. I know there is a better job being done in Charlotte, though.

DvuWEJpsEZZ9B3xwKIEEtw.text: Wife loves it so we keep coming back.  I'm never disappointed but never fully impressed either.  It helps its in a great location and we usually go before a movie date.  Service is typically just ok but they usually are busy so I'm sure that's why.

yHtprQ5Rtsqta4pMurcKpA.text: Thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant and the food was great!  Because I had not made a reservation, I did have to wait about an hour on a busy Saturday night.  The guacamole was fantastic!  Recommend making reservations ahead of time.

YBUnrLFdkVz4T0vkkjRzVQ.text: Fancy and mexican restaurant should never be in a statement together. Save yourself a few bucks and go to Zapata's instead. The food leaves you wanting more in seasoning and wondering why you spent so much for a subpar plate.

l5fNatWUzlSJ1pBUwc-6vw.text: We've gotten take out from here a few times. We never dine in because we have two toddlers and it looks like the kind of place that is just not conducive to a good family experience. I can live with that though, the food is fantastic! The guacamole is fresh and delicious, and the salsa verde is perfectly tangy and not too spicy. The fajitas are great, especially with all the little extras to elevate them like the grilled green onions, and the fresh pickled veg and cotija cheese on the side. Yum!

Qj2XjiiuMLcwMkDy5OvMMQ.text: Not too shabby. They serve pretty authentic Mexican food, so it is definitely a different dining experience. The service was quick and the waiter was fairly nice, but straightforward and to the point. It is quite pricey for what it is. I would have no problem coming back sometime in the future.

9XJ3zuy0Z9PHjBBv5DvJvQ.text: 5 stars all the way! I've dined at this location dozens of times and I am always fully satisfied. Try the street platter appetizer. The components vary day to day but it's normally a winner. Also, I am a huge fan of every single taco on the menu. Not crazy about the crab guacamole but what do you expect. Definitely one of my  favorite locations in the area!

ZlklZdGTTooFA6fy775L8A.text: Way too heavy handed with the salt!! I wanted something light so I ordered vegetarian - Enchilada Verdes. The black beans were so salty they were inedible. The enchiladas were drowning in cheese and didn't feel light at all. This felt like horribly processed chain restaurant food but cost about 50% more.

5NOo7aBFcBkbLcrH6oBVqQ.text: I love the crab & avacado quesadilla. Atmosphere is nice, but can get noisy with familes and roudy groups. I love the tableside guacamole too!

fij3o4IwMtiFpQ-6MsjFBA.text: 2 stars is being generous for my overall experience today.  I hadn't been to a Cantina 1511 since it's East Blvd days so when I was in South Charlotte to meet my husband and mother-in-law for lunch, I was all in when she suggested we meet at the Rea Road location.  We met at 11:30 and were one of about 3-4 tables.  My husband and MIL had ordered queso dip before I had arrived.  They do their own interperation of queso dip, its not the delicious goodness you find at all other Mex restaurants and it was just ok.  Service was decent, a polite young girl took our order after I arrived but that quickly went downhill after more people started coming in, though it was far from busy.  Towards the end of our meal, I ended up going to the waitress station and grabbing a water pitcher as both my husband and I were completely out of water and hadn't been checked on in quite some time.  My MIL had the cobb salad and didn't have any complaints.  My husband had the Enchiladas Tejanos.  He thought it was oily and overall not enjoyable (the man rarely complains about anything.)  I had the Enchiladas De Pollo.  It completely lacked ANY kind of flavor and was drowned in the queso dip.  Literally tasted like a plain rolled up tortilla covered in cheese and not in a good way.  Our waitress didn't even ask if everything was ok when I clearly hadn't eaten half of what was on my plate and obviously didn't ask for it to be boxed up.  Wanted to like this place as a location opened a short while ago at Park Road Shopping Center, just .25 miles from my house.  VERY DISAPPOINTED and wouldn't go back.

iwskGcZLwzChj3QRBnJDPA.text: Really enjoyed Cantina 1511. We went a few time while we lived in Charlotte. Pretty good guacamole- made tableside. Decent margaritas. Best thing on the menu is the crab/avacado quesadilla with the mexican chopped salad as a side. Love love love the chopped salad. Pretty good menu with a huge variety. Definitely recommended for anyone looking for decent tex-mex food. We had a really nice experience every time we've gone.

5Rw6gwCZVffC4LCCaFbdbQ.text: After seeing a movie, we decided to check out Cantina 1511. We arrived around 6:15 on a Sunday night and were quoted a 10 minute wait so decided to hit the bar. We ordered two house margaritas which were awesome! We were paged after about 15 minutes and seated. Once we were seated we received chips and salsa and asked if we needed a drink refill, which we did. After reviewing the menu, we chose the pork tacos and chicken fajitas. While we waited we enjoyed the fresh chips and salsa, which had a kick, which I loved. The smell in the restaurant was great so we were anxious for our food to arrive. The pork tacos were amazing! The pork was moist, almost melt in your mouth and had chopped pineapples which added a great flavor. And, the fajitas, best I have had in a long time! Piping hot, great grilled veggies, and accompanied with warm tortillas and a great assortment of sour cream, cheese, guacamole, and a few other items. What a great experience and I look forward to getting back to this location!

1jwChKE4rB6ZI6OZewNJLg.text: Got the orange duck and it was very close to 4 stars. My only complaint is the duck was a bit fatty and tough. The salsa on top was fresh and tasted a bit like lime. The rice was fluffy, light and very fresh as well. The black beans on the side was so so; not bad or good. The guacamole is made in front of you; very fresh. The only reason I didn't give this place 4 stars is the duck could have been less fatty.  I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 leche cake
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Orang duck chicken

lFmhXaNfGOhxzWd1Y_VKAQ.text: Wow...  Had not been in a few years, an my how things have changed.  Our server (Jessica) did not have a clue as to how to wait tables.  I am not sure if it was lack of training or simply her lackadaisical demeanor.  There were crushed chips under at least 40% of the tables with no effort to clean between diners.  We were given some "gluten free" chips and told they were out of regular chips.  WOW!!  Later in the meal these BAGGED chips were swapped out with not fresh fried but room temperature house made chips.  The server took my empty glass to refill my tea.  While she was away with my glass a server delivered our food, we at that point asked for silverware.  WOW!!  Jessica passed our table five times without returning my tea.  Twelve minutes later after she had passed the fifth time she returned with another glass of tea.  Cheese dip was good, and dinner was very good.  Though not what I ordered with the server.  Food is well worth the trip, but doubt I will be returning due to the extremely poor service.

SboxAHz5EFgmll11fO5Kag.text: Umm NO! It's like a Mexican Chilis. However the arepa appetizer was alright and that's about it.

GOAdA-oaFCyisT1w9ZSnWg.text: Was the best Mexican food in Charlotte by far. Has fallen off recently, but well worth a visit anyway. Fiesta!!

D6keM-8HHWebl-XR3-MaSQ.text: Sub par experience. Asked to be seated in a booth, the gentleman at the door said he didn't have any available - the restaurant was half empty. Now you're telling a guest they can't sit where they want to. Who trained you? So once we sat down I asked the server if I could move to a both, she gladly show use to a large booth. I didn't mind being sat at a six-top both because I had originally asked for a booth. There was a six top sat beside us. I guess since they all ordered drinks our two-top table was obsolete. Good thing I don't work in food and beverage to notice these mannerisms. My beer took almost ten minutes to hit the table and I never got the green salsa which I requested as soon as she greeted the table. A really tall gentleman came by because I think the server might have picked up on my frustration. He brought out the salsa!! The queso is always great and I crave their green salsa - these two reasons alone is why I thought about going. All my previous experiences have been fine but they were also at the bar.

afENIm1CqMsRyIzBwXVIdA.text: Great supreme nachos!  I was impressed with the amount of meat and things they piled on the nachos most places skimp on the toppings they don't. For my entree  I ordered the Mexican Pork BBQ which was solid nothing amazing but good.  I didn't eat alot of it because I was so full from the nachos.  You get all you can eat nachos and salsa with your meal.

ElUY82zScTxjFtAeNP4MzQ.text: We were here on Cinco de Mayo, obviously it was super busy. We had made a reservation for 5 on open table but we were running late because of an accident, I called to let them know we were running late and expected that we would have a bit of a wait when we got there. We showed up about 15 minutes late and to our surprise they held our table. I couldn't believe it considering how crazy busy it was...Our server was phenomenal- I believe his name was Stan, at least that's what it says on the receipt. He was super attentive and friendly, kept checking in to see what we needed and made small talk, I would honestly request to sit in his section again because he was that great. On top of that the food was delicious, I had a chicken chimichanga and I would dare to say it's the best one I've had since moving to Charlotte. Everyone loved their meals, and the warm chips with salsa -- we all left full and happy! My only disappointment was that I couldn't have a margarita due to being 9 months pregnant! :)

8nEC56uwLIihCy-a2ertyQ.text: Stopped by here over the weekend after a movie.  It was about 10pm so I can see why the service wasn't that great.  It didn't take long to get a seat, but it took forever to be acknowledged by a server.  We sat out in the patio, which is probably the best part of the restaurant that night.  It shares the patio with Firebird next door, and they had an acoustic guitar guy playing.  It's great ambience.    Since we filled ourselves up with movie popcorns and soda, we didn't per se have dinner.  We shared the tortilla soup and the shrimp & crab ceviche.  The ceviche was ok; the soup wasn't much to write home about, it was more like a tomato veggies soup than tortilla soup in my opinion.  For beverages, I had a white sangria which was more sweet than strong.  His dragon something was very much like a mojito and was better than my drink.  All completed with a set of dirty silverware.    In all, Cantina serves the purpose of a decent place to eat that has some kind of an atmosphere.  Definitely not the best of anything, but it's an ok option.

qHhXNiqrAXwUO9_l6Yv5bQ.text: This place is incredible. Incredible Service, Incredible Food, and Incredible Prices!!! We were served last night by Hunter D (or so says the receipt). I can quite honestly say he is one of the best waiters I have ever had.  We were seated immediately upon entering the restaurant. Within a minute or two of sitting down, our waiter came over to get our drinks started. We both ordered a beer.  He left and came back minutes later with chips and salsa (delish!!) and our beer followed closely behind. He took our order at the same time.  We ordered the tableside guac (which was delicious) and our mains. our waiter showed up again minutes later, and made the guac for us. He left and we dug right in! he came by to see if it was to our liking and we said it definitely was.  our meals arrived a few minutes later.  He was the type of waiter who knows when to approach the table, and when not to. He was there before our drinks were empty, and came by to ask how our meals were. When I asked if I could box the rest of my meal (the chimichanga is massive) he said he would do that, and also throw in the chips and salsa and the guac.  Our meal (3 beer, table side guac, chimichanga, and 3 steak tacos) came to 57.38 with tax. This will definitely be our goto Mexican! Especially if we can have Hunter as our waiter. I really can't say enough good things about him! He was absolutely incredible!

kya8BPmxhqo8QDaOrWzZPQ.text: The menu was varied, not the same old "rice and bean" Mexican fare. The food was awesome and the wait staff attentive but not constantly hovering and being intrusive. A great date place, business dinner, or fun night out on the town, I highly recommend if you are tired of the cookie cutter Mexican restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plato Carnitas

D92CXTK6s3HDlMbUXPgwSg.text: Disappointing food, great service. I ended up with Chicken Enchiladas, but I ordered cheese. But the chicken came with a tasty green chili and creme sauce. Without the sauce, they were tasteless. My husband's burrito looked good but had no flavor. Happy that I didn't pay for it.

2EdIWRadYx7PIbsmghaRvQ.text: What a delicious unique restaurant.. Not unique because of the food but because of the environment and the service.  Food - It's Mexican food.  All you have to do is close to right and it is delicious.  They easily took care of that.  I have the Johnny Carnitas Tacos and they were amazing.  The service is what blew me away.  They really know how to take care of the customer.  We sat in the bar area and were immediately greeted and our drinks were taken care of.  They told us all about the margarita options and the servers knew all everything about the dinner choices.  It was truly a wonderful experience that I look forward to experiencing again.  Tip top service, beautiful surroundings, and excellent food.  You wont be disappointed.  Enjoy!  -Ian M.

6FUnJ46Vzcu9weJM0lC_2Q.text: The food is edible, but not much more. I had the fish tacos, which I thought had a weird taste.  They tasted as if they were deep fried with the same grease used for a million other things and had not been changed for a long time. The service was bad. Took a half hour before our food came out.  Go to Mi Peublo if you want better Mexican food.  Won't be coming back here.

-zvUXr80Fsxj_D5s73cwsg.text: Try to get a table outside on Friday or Saturday night - excellent service - their manager ( sorry dint know his name) is really a great host and is very attentive. Order their Marco Polo tacos - and some margaritas - excellent food , great staff and music is a bug plus.

PJBPZxmzpdAVh1Aw2E37Zg.text: Ive been here plenty of times. Service has always ben excellent! Food is usually good. This last visit my tacos came out cold.... Sent them back and came out cold again. Server was very quick to fix the situation but did not seem to surprised by it. There was no manager to come over and apologize. Very disappointed in the resolution since there really wasn't one. My wife did not even eat her dish and the server didn't notice let alone offer to comp her meal as well. Lots of goofing around and major lack of customer service.

Vfc_IkBh7VuE2b9b0oDT6g.text: Last minute decided to go out for dinner so I called ahead for a 645pm Rez and actually got one! I was surprised since this place is always jammin and we usually get stuck at the bar. Anyhow, the waitress and hostess were both friendly and accommodating.  Both of us starving so I immediately ordered the guacamole that's prepared table side.  Nice little touch, always consistent in flavor and enough for 4 to share. A good value for $8. My entree of redfish(really, redfish is back?) was cooked perfectly, tender and still juicy.  It was smothered with roasted artichokes in a garlic butter sauce. I love garlic but somebody overdosed the sauce making it bitter and slightly displeasing.  My wife's brisket enchiladas were tender, slightly sauced, and plenty of food. We had ordered house margaritas with Patron.  Pretty good in tanginess but for a $12 drink I would not expect to have sour mix or OJ.  It takes away from the tequila. We will return, food is usually good and plentiful, but I have to question the value. Totally not related but what is up with kids dining with headphones on and watching IPads?  Can't parent talk to their children during a social dining experience? How are these kids going to learn to act in public? Really; don't get me started.  Maybe we should share the no smoking in public and tack on no electronics at the dinner table!

Dxuk5CJM8MZtyjXmQ-jY4Q.text: Tip top service, delicious guac (I gauge all mexican restaurants on their ability to make good guac) and an all around perfect eve with baby and husband.   We made an early resi on opentable, were seated immediately, baby was taken care of first and foremost by the host (always a good sign of great service in my eyes rather than "UGH...you brought a BABY?"), several waiters/hosts stopped by to make sure all was OK, and our waiter was very professional and QUICK.  He also shared a secret for making guac regarding the "order of operations" (mix lime, salt, and peppers first to bring out the True flavor of the serranos) that I was excited to learn...  Now on to the food.  DELICIOUS tacos.  DELICIOUS fajitas.  I am kind of a mexican food NUT and I have to say - we can't wait to go back.  While eating leftovers on Sunday morning (we couldn't wait until lunch) we were still talking about how good the house-made tortillas were.    The brunch looks RIDICULOUS.  (good ridiculous...)  5 stars all the way!

oRz9vXz9M2yCKLh_RKTj8g.text: Love Cantina 1511!  Delicious!!! The cheese dip is fabulous.  Our waiter encouraged us to try the cheese dip with bacon and pineapple added to it.  Sounds weird but it was YUMMY!

dfENomBPrrzkl0Ycats9_w.text: This place is great for lunch. I heart entire lunch menus that are seafood based. Mmm.   SERVICE: Friendly, prompt, but I will say unmemorable. Though not in a bad way, I suppose.  FOOD: Crab and guac tacos with shredded cabbage salad? Count me in. Many other choices involving shrimp and crab in the quesadilla and fajita areas as well.   ATMOSPHERE: Great outside area - recommended if the weather's good.  PRICE: I spent a total of $6 on my delicious lunch. Great for a work break.  En short, are you always squabbling with your work crew for a good place to get noms at lunch time? Bring them here. You won't regret.

0qADTUqLhFNnKsfVWGcsXg.text: Excellent service and the food was amazing ! I sat at the bar and the bartender was terrific ! Only problem there was a waiter training a new employee and they were way too loud and acting out , laughing and joking about the customers. Very disrespectful.

6JEdWSeufcjJiFmXZIJpOA.text: I have never been a fan of Cantina and I finally discovered why I love their menu but don't like their food.    Do I sound a bit odd?  Let me explain.  Cantina claims that they serve authentic Mexican food and they do not.  They offer authentic categories of Mexican food, but having lived and traveled extensively in Mexico this is not it.  Someone mentioned "pretentious" and that is part of my issue. A lot of flash, garnishment and slick service, but the product is not authentic at all.  Their menu is fantastic.  Such variety of common Mexican foods.  Their taco menu is the best and that is where I go when I end up here.  The tacos are in two categories: their recommended versions, different takes on toppings.  And the mix and match option whereby you can order which ones you like at at discounted price.  BUT...even some of the tacos are "jazzed-up" into unusual concoctions.  Some are odd to me.  And so are the other categories, like enchiladas, quesadillas, burritos.  I keep trying other things in the hope that it will be SOMETHING I like, but fail every time.    My discovery is that, the meal items, they all are "sweet".  Caramelized onions dominate many of the dishes and even those are sweet like they were cooked with balsamic vinegar. The pickled onions they liberally put into dishes really clashes with the food itself.  On the other hand, most of the food is bland, take the salsa and beans.  Just not to my taste, but the rating is because my odd taste preferences clash with those of my son's family, which includes three grandchildren and many others that just love 1511.  And they do have a following, but I am not one of the followers.  There are many far more authentic Mexican places that are not fancy or pretentious.  If you are looking really good Mexican, go elsewhere.

Yl2wCMXGnqbkDd6PgHAbzw.text: Great! If you're white and have never left home.  Seriously disappointed. Menu touts authentic Mexican food but the servers walked out of the Abercrombie and Fitch catalog and the only Brown faces are relegated to bus boys. If you're selling me Mexican food, hire Mexicans to cook it, sell it and serve it and let the white boys do the dishes. Speaking of diversity, do any African Americans work here? No, I don't want to see pics of you and your black friend.  Let's start with the salsa. Tastes like it uses canned tomato sauce. I asked for and added fresh cilantro, lime and salt and it was Not quite nearly edible.   I ordered 2 tacos: duck carnitas and Baja fish. They were both covered in some terrible pink picked onions. The duck taco had 2 extra ingredients...half an avocado and an inch long piece of bone that I had to fish out of my throat.   There are a million ways to make this taco better but step 1 would be stop trying to be so pretentious. Mexican food is humble elegance. The fish taco was unimpressive, after I excavated it from it's pickled onion tomb the fish was dry. This was served with a slaw that tasted fresh and was the only actual GOOD thing on the plate. It was also served with black beans (no seasoning, no taste) and some white rice with ugly canned peas and corn it it. Like they bought the cheapest frozen veggies they could find and threw it in.  The very white manager came by to see how I enjoyed my meal. I asked him what region of Mexico their food was from....he couldn't tell me.....he did mention all the cooks are Mexican when I told him this is white people food dressed up like Mexican food for people who have never traveled and don't know any better. He offered to comp my meal, I declined. He insisted on telling me how they roast the tomatoes for their salsa and all of the food was created by Mexican chefs.   Don't waste your money. Not authentic, flavor profiles lack cohesion and originality, if they have real Mexicans working they hide them in the lowest paying jobs while profiting off their culture.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. How about a bone in your duck taco.
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. The pile of gross pickled onions in my tacos next to a sad, gross, canned pea

7fjD4Wq6OBKgrqBD7TYG1g.text: This place ! Excellent customer service followed with delicious food equals an exceptional experience!   The lunch was tacos and with beans and rice. Sounds basic c right ?  The tacos were so good. One Barbacoa and one chicken . Honestly ever single bite made me think , "my god this is good ! "  It's a definite place we will return to eat !   The menu had such a great variety there was honestly a bit of a dilemma trying to decide what to choose.  The wait staff were efficient and very friendly. The whole experience was delightful ! Like Arnold says, "I'll be back ! "

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos so good it should be against the law!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco salad

PhTPHuXUVdg4OAtpPyTTmA.text: Pros:  Hearty portions. The chicken fajitas are decent but the chicken was dry the last go round.   Burritos are giant and the queso version is ridiculous. Wear your stretchy pants ;)   Full bar with daily drink specials   Salsas are good but do wish they had a bit more spice.   Cons:  Their "gluten free" chips are just Tostitos that we're not fried  Crowded and sometimes slow service   Their house margarita is crazy sweet.

jP3hD7EikC2c6IQEjT7ZFQ.text: I come here quite frequently on my lunch breaks from work.  I usually opt for the bar, instead of a table.  My go-to is the carne asada quesadillas.   The steak is always tasty and tender and it comes out fairly quickly.  It also comes served with a side/chopped salad.  The salad is better than what you might expect and I always gobble it up.  I also order the guac from time to time as well.  Of course its made at your table (or bar stool) and is served with warm, house made tortilla chips.  You simply can't go wrong with the Prima Guac @ Cantina!       I've had excellent service while sitting at the bar here for lunch.  I've had very lackluster service as well.  Either way, the staff at this establishment is always welcoming ,and friendly.  There's also plenty of parking in the busy Stonecrest Shopping Center.  If you live and breath in Charlotte, North Carolina, then I'm sure you've at least heard of Cantina before - if you haven't been down here to the Stonecrest location, give it a try, its got the same savory Tex-Mex flavor as the original location @ 1511 East Blvd!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Assada Quesadillas

q-X9T3PJIoINXlgdesNggw.text: You start out with a great amount of chips and salsa.  First place that gives you enough chips. Ordered margs but one was suppose to be without salt. Both came with salt.  Ordered the churros for dessert and they had plenty of them but they seemed over fried and only came with the raspberry sauce no chocolate like the menu says.  It was a slow night but food came out really fast but not correct. Would have rather had correct food and a little longer wait time.

Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

hW1Mo5Ham1PnnkB6w29grA.text: Service was fine. Food cake out quick, almost too quick. Was mediocre at best but way over priced. Whole dinner took 30 minutes... used to really like this place but won't be going back. Spent longer walking around target for my date night then I did trying to enjoy dinner. And don't get me started on the queso...

wnzKKBoCgI8j1By5S81EPw.text: I've been a longtime fan of this place and the margaritas. Came in on a Sunday and there was no wait which is not the norm for Charlotte. I recently have been ordering the anojittos (forgive the spelling) b/c it's the chef's pick of street food. I've never been disappointed with this pick. This time around I received friend zucchini, mini nachos, mini tostadas and churros with chocolate and what I believe to be a cherry/berry reduction. All I can say is yummy.     We also love the chips here and the salsa. The chips are thin with the perfect amount of salt. They always bring two bowls of salsa which is appreciated (especially with double dippers in your party ).

FUCHkCYbzDaQIoyW6Ri6PA.text: We are from out of town for a lacrosse tournament and called to see if they would accommodate a larger group. They were very sweet to accommodate and the food and service was amazing! We loved our sweet, patient waitress. I only wish we weren't from out of town so we could eat here regularly.

G3YPw_YKHQlIhXQZI7XZYw.text: An array of IDIOTS work here!! I have been attempting to place to go orders here for 8 months with no success. I usually end up going to Chuy's. The people Cantina has answering the phone and taking phone orders sound like 8 year olds with social anxiety issues who don't know what the word "menu" means let alone have any familiarity or mastery of it. I did once order food here this year and by the time I arrived to pick it up, I saw the open bag unattended on a bench (where you sit your ass) by the front door with some other patron digging his hand through the bag to see if he wanted to take some of my food. I alerted management who was perturbed - AT ME!!!! So I then called the health department. They were as disgusted as I was.

uRX7zh5PX0qxsyc3m8pHDw.text: I was in the same party as Christy C. and John-Michael B.  See their reviews for details.  Horrific behavior from the restaurant manager.

S15lkjpeonH0r8tLIkHpTg.text: I always enjoy the food. The chips and salsa are delicious . I have tried multiple combos of tacos and have never been disappointed, my 2 favorites are the duck and the barbacosa ? I also had the chimichanga and it's huge and delicious . The service is always attentive and friendly!

lsT83SdYz0DIeiFo9X1JNA.text: I had the Al Pastor Marinated Salmon - it was absolutely AMAZING! The salmon melts in your mouth and the sauce + goat cheese + potatoes + spinach go perfectly together!  definitely a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

F9RtfOf9fB-CqgjwW8Cgmg.text: Cantina 1511 has great service and amaaazing authentic Mexican food! And did I mention they make their guac fresh to order! Definitely coming back

Bfj2EjWLB9cX_Zt_8uUdRw.text: Love this place but, with 10 four tops and booths open they put our table of 4 at a big round 10 top.  We can't reach the chips.  We can't reach the queso.  Totally bizarre.  Food great as usual.

DKqBPstMaH_NDVFs4UryDQ.text: Love this place! Fajitas and guacamole were fantastic, I have never had a bad meal here. Our waitress Carly was great, made the experience wonderful. Ended with quatro leches cake and I'm stuffed!

TnJ4rPXnXoOBjT4is2_dRw.text: Tonight I was hungry and was not disappointed! Excellent fresh guacamole made table side with plenty of  chips and salsa. Our chimichangas were hot and filling. We are never disappointed at Cantina 151!

58XiM4DBHAfKWe6Xu69cvA.text: Service was absolutely awful. Food was fine but service was below average. As working in the restaurant business I understand servers being behind on a busy night but when it isn't that busy, no excuse.

O_8UawINfHzQ2-dYNRYAkw.text: Great tacos, wonderful service, creative cocktail offerings. Get there early or make a reservation as this place fills up fast!  Best salsa and chips in town!  And, that's saying a lot coming from a native Texan who is exceptionally particular about her Mexican food.

MhtKpdL-YeWz4-XcLv-phQ.text: Stopped in here for dinner and drinks with friends last night.  Upon entering the place I noticed the look and feel is almost identical to that of the one off East Blvd.  Not a bad thing.  Large bar area to the left was open and inviting and the service from the moment we stepped in was great.  I was a little off put by the fact that this night they had run out of steak and scallops but I suppose these things happen from time to time.  I got a Southwestern salad with chicken and wasn't dissapointed.  Also the gauc was very good, although at $9.50 a bit pricey.  Parking is a little crazy in Stonecrest as you might already know so be prepared to walk after parking.

VVaVH587OMee3M133NeS3A.text: Had drinks and dinner at the bar- food was fantastic, and Chelsea was attentive and did everything she could to make us feel welcome!

ZcxDpvrcD0Med4hPcDxbIw.text: Went for lunch with 2 co-workers...food was excellent once again.  Lunch portions are sized really well.  I had the fish tacos lunch portion and was very satisfied with the amount of food.    Our server, Adrian, was very knowledgable and made some excellent suggestions on meal choices that proved to be on point.  Food came out well prepared and in a timely manner.    I would recommend anyone go there for lunch ASAP!

o0oZRwHv6OMknsHl3XClNw.text: Went to Cantina last night...not real busy Decided to wait for a patio table. Did not take long for tables to open up but no buzz from the hostess station so we went up and asked. They replied they needed to clean the table. Another 10-15 goes by and I peeked out to the patio...4 open tables...so I went back up and said were ready to be seated...the hostess was stippy and said the same thing...need to be clean so I said no the don't there are 4 tables open. She huffed  and walked us to our table. I have run restaurants and would certainly want to know if guest were being treated like this by the restaurant initial contact. I asked for a manager...one showed up 20 minutes later...sorta so late we just chalked up the visit to a joke. Food was fair Music was Great. We've been to Cantina many times...this was most likely our Last Visit. Go at your own risk...new ownership has really let thing slip. PM

0Y_l-vYicytMVZ4auVfoHQ.text: I am not quite sure how people manage to call this Mexican food. I ordered the enchiladas de pollo and I was absolutely disgusted. There was so much queso on top of my enchiladas that it made it extremely hard to eat. I might as well have just ordered queso as my main entree. The side of rice that was given to me looked and tasted like fried rice from a local Chinese restaurant.   My service was outstanding and that is probably the only thing that was great about my dining experience. I definitely will not be returning. If I want some Mexican food, I will head to Central Ave. for some authentic food.

hc2OkvadMCH6lD0D6CbI8Q.text: We ate here on a Sunday evening and it was overall great experience.  We were seated instantly --though it wasn't busy at all, and the staffs were very efficient.  Seconds after we had been seated we were brought chips and salsa and drink orders were being taken.  The meal itself was also brought out very quickly.  I ordered their chicken fajitas and we ordered a side of con queso cheese.  The cheese was very good, though it was served a bit cold, and the fajitas were excellent.  The fajitas were served with lettuce, guacamole, tomatoes, cheese and picked onions --which were interesting but very good!  The fajitas were served on a traditional sizzling cast-iron pan and were absolutely wonderful.  That consisted of onions, peppers, chicken --the standard fajita plate.  My wife ordered a chicken burrito and was quite surprised when it was put on the table --it would have been difficult to fit this thing through the Channel Tunnel in Europe!  The burrito was gigantic --and very tasty, too!  Overall this was a great experience and we really enjoyed the food.  The service was second to none --though the restaurant was pretty slow.  I felt the food was a bit pricy; however, the service and great taste offset that and therefore I felt the price could be justified.  I cannot wait to go back!

1oTakc-b6w5pHCCKq3BFvg.text: My husband and I have been regulars at Cantina Rea Rd for the past few years. Our last couple of visits have been disapointing. Our last visit was this week and I think it will  be our last. We ordered the shrimp fajitas and the Enchilada Verde. We were disapointed with both. The shrimps on he fajitas were smaller than ususal and the vegetables were thinner than any other time. The plate was full of caramalized onions.  The Enchilada Verde was not even close to the description on the menu. According to the menu, the plate is prepared with spinash and mushrooms. Yet , the plate we got was nothing but a combination of melted cheeses.   The service was ok but nothing special.

Bk2uTs4f3-7sQN-ZuCy7Uw.text: So yummy! We always go here after the movies (free table side guacamole with movie stub)! I'm a fajita girl and theirs is pretty great with mushrooms and zucchini. The margarita sampler is a great value.. Three fairly large samples. I wish they hadn't gotten rid of the "Twiggy" margarita though.. Fresh lime juice and agave.. Yum!

PmWTUeSuQihUHdJSFejxiA.text: Allow me to explain my ratings: 4 stars for the food, 2 stars for the revamped menu (read: PRICE HIKE).  Cantina tends to be my go-to place for Mexican. More because my daughter seems to love it here, and it's hard to please the culinary habits of a picky 5-year-old. We never go wrong here. We love the service - the waitstaff always seem to be personable, and I always appreciate management coming around just to say hi - and the food, a little more upscale take on more traditional Mexican fare (as opposed to, say, Tex-Mex, which is traditional, yes, but more akin towards Yanqui tastes, so you know) that always hits the spot.  So when I saw the menu had changed, I cringed. Menu changes often mean bad things, like some of your favorite plates have been unceremoniously removed from the menu. Alas, some of my favorite taco plates are no longer an option. Still, there's plenty more to chose from, and I did enjoy the shrimp and scallop tacos.  However...lunch the other day was $55. SERIOUSLY? Between my 3-taco plate, my wife's chicken quesadillas, my daughter's quesadilla's, a bowl of plantains, and a pint of beer, that all came out to $55, not including tip?   Wow. I can afford to drop $55 for lunch, but I object on principle. There better have been about 3 or 4 more pints of Negra Modelo included in that bill.  Oh well. You'll likely see me back at Cantina, except this time I'll be a bit more judicious about what I order, just to satisfy my frugality.

GXIiw2cSmQDE-TDLj6N9Mg.text: I had the shrimp tacos-excellent.  The complimentary chips and salsa is very good and fresh.   Customer service was great not a long wait at all for a Friday night.

dzTj5lo339AxByT722ZpeQ.text: I love avocados, but after eating a ton of this goodness with this restaurant's delicious, made at your table guacamole, seeing a thick slice of fatty avocado on top of every other part of my meal was a bit overmuch.   But get the guacamole. The spinach enchiladas were also good, if very cheesy. The black beans were a little salty.  The corn fritters were talked up by our server, but they didn't really deliver, and I'm unsure I would serve them as a desert. The peach dessert was much better, probably because we are in Cackalack while they are in season!  The service was outgoing and friendly, helpful and quick to attention. Good service.  This is Mexican that is supposedly fancified, but it seems mostly you're just paying more for stuff that seems to be modestly better than the cheap, gut-busting stuff. Try it for yourself, but I'm going to keep lookin!

2D2BpWxa01su0z9vfjNR-Q.text: I'm not one to usually write a review, but in this case I must.  I'm a chef here in Charlotte and if this happened at my restaurant I'd go absolutely nuts.  We came here on July 4th as we were going to the movies in the same center.  First we had to wait 10 minutes to be sat.  Now this would not be a problem had it not been for the fact there where only 5 tables in there.  There were almost as many servers as customers so you kinda see my point here.  The person who said he was our server was to busy so someone else came to get our drink order. Again waited 10 minutes for them,. Next we placed our order and waited 20 minutes for our food.  Not unreasonable,but considering the amount of people there, kinda surprised.  My girlfriend is a little picky about thinks so when we go to a Mexican restaurant she always has the same thing, two cheese enchiladas with diced onion on top. I know everyone has there own version of things, and they claim to be authentic Mexican food, but NOT EVEN CLOSE.  The enchilada sauce looked and tasted like it was tomato based. It had similar flavors of enchilada sauce but that's were it stopped.  I had the steak chimichanga and it was a lot of fat on the steak.  At least for my taste.  When the manager came by to see why she didn't like it, he was very defensive and almost seemed rude about claiming, this is how we do it.  Well I get that but then how can you say your authentic Mexican if you do it your way.  In short I don't recommend this place and we will never come back.  It's a shame this doesn't have negative stars on it

UaTev7jJl6vq9rNwHN11Ww.text: First when you walk in the door, very friendly host staff. The cantina area is great for drinks and/or dinner, and the bartenders are friendly and accommodating as well. They make a great margarita and always have good beers on tap...happy hour is a blast! Nice place to unwind after work, lots of business people go there. Dining in the main floor is hit or miss though; food is good but wait staff needs to step it up...service is a little slow if it's filled up. Nice place for a group or family. Very kid friendly. I'd say a 7.5/10 experience combined-food, service, and cantina area.

PghbExvLnZZqDviZY7dMrw.text: I have to edit my previous 4 star review down to two stars... it was purchased from the group that owns Mama Ricotta's, Bad Daddy's, Paco's Taco's and Plate Perfect Catering by some guy named Richard Campbell. Since this change in hands, the food quality has dropped off a bit. It's still good, but not as good as it used to be and for the price you pay there, that's not a good thing. The one thing that bothers me most about this place and will probably cause us to seek out a new Mexican restaurant in our area is the fact they have a "lunch" menu that's really just a shortened version of their dinner menu with no break in price. There are no "lunch specials" like you'd find at any restaurant, but especially a Mexican restaurant. We have one more "living social" type coupon we're going to use up there and then we're done.

m4M5Y2UnWM45vwX2cLyelw.text: There's no easy way to put this, after going here I feel violated.  I ordered the grilled pork loin and my wife ordered the vegetable picadillo enchiladas.  I was served two crispy burned pork loins floating in a bland "peanut" sauce that tasted like it belonged more on a Thai menu.  The plate was over sauced, the "queso mashed potatoes" were bland and as hard as a rock...  Then there were the slightly burned, out of season asparagus, no crisp to them, just limpy old food.  To make matters worse, my wife's dish was inedible.  She was served, no joke, instant rice with dried peas and carrots.  They at least squeezed some lime juice on it.  The vegetables in the soggy tortillas were over cooked to the point that they were little rubber bits of bitter tasting vegetables.  We're not picky eaters, but this honestly was an insult served to us on a plate.  I would have sent it all back but our server quickly grabbed our plates and bagged it up for us after she saw we weren't eating.  This was honestly the worst meal I have ever been served that came out of a professional kitchen.  Take my advice, drive five more minutes down the road and go to Senor Tequila.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Pork (more like burned pork)

H1r0Ex8-hu8Rpn4JMj1G7w.text: Cantina is okay. Not great. I had a margarita flight that I probably should have asked the price of before buying. It was good but not worth $15. I went with a semi-large group of people and we got a great waiter. He told us what the specials were for the night, and my mother and I opted to try. It was shrimp and scallops with some kind of corn and cilantro aioli? (Maybe lol). He warned that we probably shouldn't share, but we decided to anyway. He was right. Two shrimp. Two scallops. On a PILE of corn. On top of that the shrimp were tough. (Also not worth the price. Close to $30) So I ordered some some chicken dish that was a chicken breast filet with a small wing attached? (Again maybe...lol). It came with potatos and peppers. It was a little bland. I'm glad we had a great waiter. Other than that it's nothing you should be in a hurry to get to.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margarita flight! Good but not $15 good.

smqVK1Xp5mFLtoEQsDxoZg.text: Guacamole was good prepared at your table. Shrimp taco was cold when it arrived but asked waiter if he could get me a hot one & it was excellent. Chicken taco was not that good. The chicken tasted like it was boiled, no flavor. The rice & beans were not good. Beans were hard with no flavor and rice was undercooked with no seasoning or flavor. Just blah. First Mexican restaurant we've been to where we didn't like the rice & beans. Their wait staff was very friendly and courteous.

eS6kkwfn2ENaXzYMPfjdig.text: The waitress is friendly.the food its ok the reason for 3 star after i order tacos the food take 35 minutes ta get in my table. I will back again for second chance

fsO3HbHcDNa0JwwfLjpF0Q.text: Food is ok. Table side guac is very good. I found the best idea when looking for a good food and casual experience is eating in the bar area. The appetizers/small dishes are the best choice for the palate and money.

9BaSj0_j3VXzQgUAZyWwQQ.text: Been there twice. Loved it both times. Great drinks! Busy but great service. In a good area. Tasty food.

WWQi9M3tOd_MTNGSBCzqqQ.text: Today we enjoyed a late lunch at Cantina 1511.  We were in the super South Charlotte area, and I never turn down unlimited chips and salsa, so we ended up here!  I have been to other Cantina 1511s but never this location.    We arrived around 2pm on a Saturday and it was pretty slow so we had a choice of tables.  Chips and salsa came quick, I asked for the spicy salsa and they brought a habanero that both me and my husband loved so much we had refill 3x!  We loved our tacos, I had a carnitas and a pulled chicken taco, he had three other types.  I especially enjoyed the slaw it came with, I wish it came with more!  The rice and black beans also had amazing flavor.  It was also mixed with a few peas, carrots and corn.  I'd definitely get their tacos again!  Service was ok- my husband had to ask for his drink as it was forgotten.  With how quiet it was, that surprised me!  Delish food, for sure, but I was somewhat turned off by the 91% sanitation rating hanging when you walk in.  Hopefully they will improve that soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carnitas and Pulled chicken taco- nice and smoky flavor

T7HczJ1QRg2Yrap2z-rYFw.text: I have a huge nacho addiction and after trying most places if not all near Ballantyne I have to say that I'm loyal to Cantina 1511, we go every weekend, their S'western Nachos and  Carne Asada Fries are no joke, chips and salsas are the best! Love the habanero and their regular red sauce.  Great service, fair prices, all the staff is very nice and friendly. They are fast, very great attention to detail when orders are customized. Vince, great guy as well, i think he is one of the managers, very professional and I've seen him on the floor making sure everything is in order, he even took care of a to-go order for us once and I point this out because we are from Puerto Rico and you don't really see managers working hard and hands on.   My wife loves their chips too and we buy them in catering domes for us or for any party or get together that we are invited and we really make a huge impression.

r0C5z827obVrJBtdEGpSUQ.text: I truly enjoyed our dining experience here. We had a group of eight which is always difficult including a new born. We were quickly accommodated and received wonderful service from the entire staff.  The menu and food were good but the service was spectacular

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

uDi27FH-yMCQc2Zb1IHGSg.text: I reserved a table for 11 people at Cantina 1511 for a family celebration.  The day of our reservation, someone from the restaurant called to confirm our arrival time.  During the call, I made them aware that we had a special request for a more secluded table because due to a medical condition.  I was hoping for a corner table or even one that stretched along a wall.  To my surprise (and delight!) they seated us at one of their glass-enclosed tables.  It was like having a room all to ourselves!  Our server, Matt, took amazing care of each and every one of us.  He kept our drinks and chip baskets full.  Our meals were perfect and everyone had a delightful time.  I cannot say enough about the top-notch service we received here!  Thank you, thank you, thank you to all the staff at Cantina 1511 who made this a memorable meal for our family!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

xf-q5PB6vxtxruPGtxDA9g.text: My husband chose to celebrate Father's Day dinner here, so we finally revisited this popular destination located in Stonecrest at Piper Glen.   This used to be our go-to Mexican restaurant in town, but got sick of the long line and opted to go elsewhere for the longest time. Well, this time around, I made a fairly early dinner reservation in advance...and we slid right in!  The place seemed a little more colorful this time around. Think they might have redecorated since our last visit? Still, some of the booths seemed marked up with crayons/pens (probably by children); and they were in dire need of renovation!   Anyway, we were escorted to a huge booth by the window (love these huge booths!); and we began our Mexi fiesta with the complimentary Nachos and Dip.   For my entree, I ordered the 3-Tacos platter ("Johnny Carnitas", "Carne Asada" and the "Korean BBQ Beef"), which of course, came with Mexi Rice and Beans. Well, all I can say is WOW. Can't remember the last time I had tacos that were THIS good...all three tacos were equally Dee-Lish!! I also loved their rice, and even their beans (given that I'm not a fan of Beans). Here, they also offer you the option to choose the type of tacos AND the type of beans!  My husband chose the Enchiladas de Pollo, and my son had Ancho Chicken Quesadillas...and they both seemed to love them as well.  The service was good. Not exceptional, but not bad either. Surprisingly, the place wasn't as bustling as I expected it to be...especially for Father's Day. But as we were leaving, close to 7:30 pm, I noticed that the crowd definitely got bigger.  Overall, we had a truly fulfilling, satisfying meal. We left thinking that maybe we've given up on this place a tad too soon. Yep...we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3-Taco (Mix &#39;n Match) Platter with Rice and Beans

jhKsPuGjwthOSBnRfPI1vQ.text: Hosts/Hostesses were very friendly and welcoming. We arrived early for our reservation so we had a drink at the bar. The bartender (Julian) was very friendly and attentive!  We made our reservation on Open Table and were seated at our reserved time (6:00 on a Friday). Our server (can't recall his name, but he was originally from Boston) was super friendly and attentive. I picked up on his accent and we struck up a conversation about Boston/New England as my husband and I are from there originally, as well. Really nice guy!  Food was very good. We ordered table-side guacamole and queso. We're eating low-carb so our server brought us veggies to dip instead of chips. My husband ordered the Steak & Chicken fajitas (sans tortillas) and I had the carne asada. Everything was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

o__gpKlZZyrYkLoEXy_Fkg.text: This is our favorite Mexican restaurant. The fajitas are amazing, salsa is delicious and the chips give me life. We love the ambiance and the margaritas, and our kids love food here too. Thank you for blessing of chicken tenders on a kids menu! Anytime we're nearby we make it a point to stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

mJgACwYcc1XnJw7LtYbyUw.text: First time dining here and I was very disappointed.   The rice was truly minute rice, not authentic at all.  Do not waste your time.  The meat is out of a can and not cooked fresh.  I gave it two stars for the ambiance and service.  It was my first time here and it will be my last.

msSS84pB3R3ziYMnxNrHRg.text: I can't remember what this restaurant used to be before it became 1511 only due to the fact that I used to work in the Regal theater when I was in high school, but I think Cantina 1511 is a nice addition to the restaurant selection in Stonecrest.  Granted the original was on East Blvd, but I believe the menu is similar.  The dining room is such a large space, there are dividers that have curtains so maybe you can rent out corners or pockets of the restaurant for private parties.  There's a revolving door as the entrance which is totally unique to a restaurant in the "burbs."  I bet 90% of the people use the side doors anyway - Maybe a Charlotte thing, but the only revolving doors I've come across are uptown (and hardly anyone uses them as well).  We were greeted at the host stand and promptly seated (we were also there on an "off" peak time... 4:30pm so super early dinner.  Our server was friendly and we had a nice meal.  I had the enchiladas suizas and my  mom had two tacos.  Since we were there early, the restaurant felt a little empty, but it seemed like more and more people were coming in as we were leaving.  It was also a weekday.  Never-the-less, I'm a fan of this option here in Stonecrest, granted there is a Chipotle and other fast food options.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enchiladas Suizas refried beans and rice

AVI4qlneU_PBc32DZLvPvQ.text: I always enjoy the food at cantina 1511 can't say enough good things. Starting with the chips and salsa the salsa is scratch made everyday and there's many tacos to choose from. Staff is friendly with great suggestions on what to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Got the Texas taco, Johnny carnitas and the ancho chicken taco with a side of rice and slaw.

47MLzYjPVV8RlsMJI3V2XA.text: We go to the Cantina at Park Road quite a bit since we live close to it.  My Husband and I came to the Cantina at Stonecrest for a Surprise Birthday Party.  The food was good, this review is strictly based on the service and experience.  The reason for the two star review is because of the bizarre situation that occurred when we finished eating.  The waitstaff did a decent job with our big party, but didn't keep track of what we ordered.  At the end of the meal we waited for a really long time for our checks.  Before our checks were brought out the staff asked what we ordered.  It was really unorganized and confusing for everyone trying to leave to get home to their children.  We left at different times due to some couples having to get home to relieve babysitters.  After everyone had paid and half of the party had left, the manager came out and announced to everyone that we did not meet the $800 minimum for reserving the room and there was a $40 tab worth of drinks that needed to be paid.  We thought this was so wild because the wait staff didn't put those unclaimed items on our checks.  We had no idea there was anything that was not paid for and we would all more than gladly cover the tab.  The manager did this in front of the party instead of just pulling the gentleman aside that had reserved the room.  It was really embarrassing and unprofessional.  We also found it hard hard to believe that we didn't meet the minimum as each couple (13 total) spent an average of $75.    I absolutely hate giving a two star review but the manager didn't apologize and it made the end of the evening very awkward and uncomfortable for our entire group that had just spent a lot of money.

TrDPCoi50Kb5A4kaALyZ9g.text: Came here last night after a grueling day. My husband and I ordered drinks and got the complimentary chips and salsa. We ordered a queso fundito with chorizo as an appetizer. Not sure what we got. It was a small pot if melted cheese. Not slightly melted, but a liquidy mush and if there was chorizo in it it was so finely chopped we couldn't see it. We expected to be able to wrap the cheese into the flour tortillas we got but instead, we could only dip them because the cheese was so loose. It tasted like cheese whiz with salt.  We waited about twenty minutes for the two bartenders to see if we needed another round but they ignored us. One yapping about himself for a half an hour with two women and the other just running around past us about thirty times. Even after we stood up to signal we were ready to leave it took too long get the check. Terrible food and service.

HT3Fu6ISn2cS0p0gfum26Q.text: I had high hopes for this place, their menu looked good. Unfortunately it took over 5 minutes for a waitress to stop by and over 15 minutes for them to revisit for a food order. Waitress wasn't busy( the place was pretty empty being Thursday), asked for the bill for the daughters sprite but this one was on the house for the poor service. The waitress called the manager over (I don't ever ask for them) and he was apologetic and offered an appetizer and faster service, great on his part but I was set on leaving.  The salsa was delicious, born and raised in San Diego so I can appreciate good Mexican food. The water was good as well

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

ONMAP_VPgA2e-laschO0TA.text: Upscale Mexican in Charlotte. Decided to take the fam into cantina as we were in the neighborhood and I've had decent experiences there. This time things went a little different. As I've stated before cantina's fit and finish is quite good, it presents like a Disney theme restaurant. It wasn't too busy on a Saturday at 5:00. We ordered the kids chicken burrito, kids chicken quesadillas, steak burrito bowl, and fish tacos with queso as a starter. The food itself arrived in a fair amount of time and service was friendly and attentive. The food itself was more of the issue this time our. The queso was actually quite good. The burrito bowl was soupy however and the beef over cooked and dry. The chicken in both kids dishes was a bit spicy for little people and also very dry. The fish tacos was the line bright spot which my wife reported as very good. When we got the bill I was also surprised to see that the queso was $10, which was more of my fault as I should have looked at the price when the server offered it. Still though a little pricey for some cheese. In all I might not make it a point to go back when in the area again as there are lots of food options around that need exploring.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside shot

jj6B6Xp92qz-W5aCp-8xbg.text: This place used to be the bomb! The last few times we've been has just been average. Not the servers fought but the service from the bar was super slow as the food came out before beers. The air-conditioner was broke in the restaurant on 100 degree day. Made us miserable to say the least. We've had many celebrations at this restaurant but will be finding a new place to gather with friends. The manager did come over and help out with getting our drinks and took off an appetizers ($9 guac). The table next to us was having the same experience. I had the worse heartburn ever from the margaritas, probably from cheap mixer.

HmOQPS0QWuFBAgzgJfdsBw.text: My office had a fajita bar catered in for a birthday lunch and I can say with confidence...this was the best bday lunch we have had all year. Everything was delicious!  It came with all the fixins'...rice, peppers, steak or chicken, queso, cheese, tomatoes etc.  Check out my pics to see that amazing salad topped with Avocado...OMG!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fajita bar!!!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Check out that salad!
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not your average rice

OwmG4oSEyizPSHFVvYmuRg.text: My husband and I dined here on a Sunday evening. We arrived at 7:30pm after seeing a movie at the Regal in the same complex. What a disappointment honestly! We didn't select this restaurant based off of Yelp reviews, but instead we came here out of convenience.  We started off ordering two house margaritas on the rocks, 1 with salt and 1 without. Both came with salt and I was disappointed but didn't even point it out to the waiter because I didn't want to be "that person."    We didn't order an appetizer because we had popcorn at the theater so we smacked on the complimentary chips and salsa which were tasty. Chips were crisp and lightly salted. Salsa may have been jarred or homemade but had a kick to it.   We decided to try the date night special for $25 where we could each pick an Entree from a limited menu and then could share a dessert. I ordered a chimichanga with steak and specifically asked for no sour cream. My husband ordered a chimichanga with chicken with everything on it.   The food came out about ten minutes later. (Almost too fast?) The waiter handed me what seemed to be the correct plate until we cut into it and found they reversed our orders. So then we had to switch plates and I had to scrape the sour cream off of mine. This may not seem like a big deal however the sour cream was touching the slaw and lettuce in addition to touching the beans and queso that was spilling over the chimichanga. I personally abhor sour cream so I was really annoyed.    Then I noticed I had about a teaspoon of guacamole on my plate AND no pico de Gallo. Meanwhile my husband had generous portions of each. I was pretty annoyed at this point. The waiter bought me a tiny thing of pico de gallo which was appreciated. Honestly the food wasn't very good anyway and the guacamole tasted pretty bland.   The churros that accompanied the meal took longer than the meal did to come out and that's probably because they were over fried. The Melba sauce served on the side tasted like something poured out of jar or bottle and was extremely sweet.    All in all, I was very disappointed with attention to detail and the taste/quality of the food served. We will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Churro tower
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. House margarita
Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States

aLnEjS0r0l_kmIM6z6XRLw.text: What has happened to this restaurant. We have gone there many times and it was busy. Went last night and it was dead for a Friday night. We have ordered the Chimichanga many times and loved it. Last night it was disgusting. It was all black beans and rice. I had to search for the ground beef and there was no cheese. We ordered a side of refried beans which arrived in a bowl and looked like soup and had no flavor. Needless to say, we won't be back.

_3So7vNuR1zk7T2FPzL95g.text: Latest visit, we were seated outside with a pretty empty dining room and sat for 20 minutes while 4 different servers ignored us. Finally walked up to a waiter we saw and said we had been ignored, waited five more minutes and just walked out. Will probably not come back for a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso!!

UTF2rUcBSPKDmDC8un8OhA.text: Girls day out! We started with the table side guacamole, and queso. Both were great. I had the choose 2 taco combo, with the gobernador tacos, black beans and rice. The shrimp in the tacos were plump and juicy. The salsa and slaw that accompanied were wonderful.   Washed it all down with a orange Tijuana taxi, with a gran marnier side car. Excellent meal, we'll be back!

wMo6DTyIkEF7MYQkZQg89A.text: Not a very good experience.  We went there to celebrate my daughter. Went with a couple that had a 5 month old baby.  When we got there it was not busy at all since it was about 515.  Our waitress wasn't bad, but our food took forever. It probably took over an hour. At that point in time the baby wasn't happy, we weren't hungry because we ate so many chips and salsa. The food wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. The manager did apologize and gave us this weird dessert that no one liked. The store was not busy at all, and we saw a lot of other people looking around for their food too.  Would not recommend to go go any later, if this was the case at 515.

ODoAU3W9ZefVOqobCAQY6w.text: We've eaten there many times. Just had lunch there on Saturday. Sat outside. We decided to have Margaritas and a couple of us tried a Drag N Berry. Margaritas were very good. The Drag N Berry was very syrupy/heavy but had good flavors and was heavy on the alcohol. Would have rather had homemade lemonade with a shot of something but they were out of lemonade. Love their taco selection - great combinations. I had a puerco al pastor, that had pork and pineapple (yum) and another that was brisket cooked in red sauce. They have a couple of good Mexican beers on tap, and had $3 blue moons as the special. We had a very nice relaxed meal with an attentive waiter. Try it you'll like it!!

VzazJcSpxLZv-Gtd7UUZCA.text: This is my favorite place for Mexican in the city. I'm so glad they moved into their Park Rd. location because parking is so much easier. My only suggestion would be to make a reservation if you're going at a popular time. My favorite dishes are the chimichangas, enchiladas and their fish tacos. LOVE the salsa!

DPzZaiGD-BSlL-ahYgpHyA.text: I don't give five stars very often, but had to give it up to Cantina 1511 after having an AMAZING dinner there for Charlotte Restaurant week this month.  Typically, I wouldn't choose to go to a Mexican place for an expensive dinner since I believe you can get really good Mexican food for cheap at other places, but this place had good reviews and was worth a shot so we went.  Everything we had for dinner was delicious.  We started off with the guacamole.  I was at first disappointed with the small portion, but as soon as I saw the portions of the rest of our meal, I was glad I didn't waste my appetite on just the first course!  I had their salad while my husband had the soup and both were very tasty.  We were already getting pretty full from appetizers when our main courses came out and they were just...OMG.  If you go, you MUST try the short rib.  Juicy, tender, full of flavor and HUGE!  We ended up having to take most of our meal home because we wanted to save it for another day!  The server was also so amazing and attentive.  I mentioned I was allergic to nuts and the dessert they had slated for the Restaurant Week menu had nuts and he was able to replace it with the bread pudding instead, and the bread pudding was literally the best that I've ever had in my entire life.  I would go back just to have the bread pudding again.  Again, I tend to be pretty critical of places and even some of my favorite places I've only given four stars, but had such a great experience here, it definitely deserves five stars and another visit!

Kheavk0vnDw3lzIaZ6fdlQ.text: The worst service ever. Had to beg for a menu and then they would never come back to take our order. Atrocious!

eLkleZtCCy_R9xbjXP3-YA.text: Cantina 1511 receives only 2 stars from me.  It's not just the food.  The food is decent.  For me, it's the price.  I think Cantina 1511 is ridiculously expensive, given the quality of the food!  Again, the food isn't bad though.  It's just average.  Let me give you an example.  I went there to eat with my wife and two kids.  The kids are under 10 years old.  We ordered some guacamole for appetizer, I had a beer, my wife had a mixed drink, the kids had lemonade.  One of the kids had one taco, the other had the quesadilla appetizer for dinner.  My wife and I each had a regular entree.  The bill was $71!  I can think of a lot of better meals we all could have had for $71!  This is the second time I have been to Cantina 1511.  Friends of mine seem to really like the place.  Unfortunately, I don't think I'll be back.

aSV9ByraT6gOufKqpm4NAQ.text: Thanks to all the Yelper's,  as we chose this restaurant for tonight's adventure.  You ask why I call it an adventure......because you never know the service that I am going to receive.  I started today's adventure via yelp, I investigated a few reviews, visited the website via yelp, and then placed my reservation online for 7pm.  Being that this was our first time here we arrived promptly at 6:54pm, we were greeted by three lovely young ladies at the hostess stand. We were seated immediately, in what I will refer to as the Tarzan room. (they must have known of my wild adventures in previous posts on yelp)  Our servers name was Ryan, he was very kind, polite, and efficient with his tasks of serving our needs of tex-mex food.  He asked if this was our first time in and of course, we replied yes. He was familiar with the specials and stated that if we needed any assistance with the choices he would be very willing to assist.  He allowed just enough time to look over the menu, and returned promptly to take our order.  Tonight's meal included 2 beef tacos, and the Mexican City Steak Fajitas. ( I have included a picture of my meal) Our drinks were Coke and water, he was very prompt with the refills.  The restaurant was very busy tonight, but the food was hot, fresh and very timely in it's arrival to our table. Unlike many of my other dining experiences, it is becoming less of an adventure and more of a tour of how a restaurant should be, efficient, and friendly.  The tortillas were very nice, fresh, crisp, and the salsa was very pleasant, not too hot, not too mild.  As momma bear says.....it was just right.  The music other Yelper's speak of was not much of a concern to us as we were in a separate room away from the main dining area. Our conversations were easily heard and was not too loud as others suggest.  When the meal came out, the portions were very reasonable, it was hot fresh, and very appealing.  My senses were blasting.  From the  sound of the fajitas, the smell of fresh cooked vegetables on a very hot skillet and the taste.....oh my it was delicious. ( It looks better than my photo as I did not want to use the flash)  The texture was very good, and I enjoyed the small side plate of fajita accessories which consisted of cheese, sour cream, lettuce, dices tomatoes, carrots, guac,  and onions. I needed more fajita bread, and our server had these delivered at no additional charge.  Based on this experience, I will provide 4 stars, it was less of an adventure, and more of an enjoyable night out.  Thanks Cantina 1511, for providing an easy and enjoyable meal, and for all you Yelper's who have not tried this place, go ahead, give 'em a try.  They have a beautiful patio, good food, nice atmosphere, and good service.  I may just have to use this experience as my gauge for 4 stars, I just can't see how tonight could have been much better.  NCFoodGuy
