AC9UFBfRixmESg-JiStJFw.text: Get the tacos with the soft white flour shell, biggest drawback is the atmosphere at least in the bar area way too dark.

FswK3TplZvYD23aXXO2_Bw.text: One of the few great mexican options in the Charlotte area!  While there are several things we don't enjoy from this menu, there are tons of options and you are bound to find the right meal for you.  Lately, we have been following the paleo lifestyle and it's difficult to eat out.  Not the case here surprisingly.  There are plenty of fajita options, ceviche options, and other dishes.  Prior to following Paleo, we always ordered nachos, enchiladas, margaritas and were more than satisfied!  I very much enjoy the basic mexican dive, but if you want to step it up a notch with a bit of American flare in recipe, stop in Cantina 1511.

JUxtnEQyZcJeTs_X_U_c7Q.text: Wow! Just experienced the rudest waiter in bar area! Rude before I could even ask about a drink!  There were no seats and didnt like that I was standing near his customer.  He came to apologize a few minutes later, but again with attitude! No drink for us!asking me to move nicely would have been fine!

gTfJQ5kebMfjNZH-NAg43w.text: I love this place! The food is fresh, and the service is great! We love taking out of town guests to cantina to give them a taste of our local food scene.

CzlKmfocsJ88fYQbdZ6D9w.text: We came here on a Saturday night in hopes of giving this place another try. The first time had to of been 10 years ago and it was awful. I made a reservation thinking it would be packed (wasn't). Our waiter was pretty impatient and wouldn't stick around to hear 3 people order. He showed us the drink menu but kept walking away before we could order. He snapped at my mom when she asked for a regular margarita instead of telling him the name of the one she wanted. He asked her to refer to the menu that he previously showed her. It was pretty rude and awkward. Her margarita ended up being straight sour mix and it the worst drink I've ever seen prepared (just graduated college and those bars make a better marg).... We kept getting baskets of chips that were only crumbs, which was frustrating. When we got our food it was a lot. The ingredients seemed fresh and well prepared. I wouldn't say it was anything special though. The price is pretty high for what it is. I probably wouldn't go back and from the looks of it they probably won't be there much longer. Next door had a lot more business. Poor service, expensive food. Do not recommend

O3vvbpJyiia5IhiOH7PbZA.text: A few months ago we visited this restaurant for dinner, weren't impressed, and I wrote a less than positive ( but accurate ) review.  Last night we decided to stop by again for cocktails and an appetizer. We sat at the bar - and left feeling completely satisfied. The only reason I'm not giving them a full 5 Stars is because we didn't order a full meal. But the guys behind the bar ( Julian & staff ) did a great job, we got our appetizer in a reasonable amount of time, the staff was friendly, our drink was good, and overall we left very pleased.

jabx5D8dILTmE-pTpCuiRg.text: Cantina 1511, I want to love you but I cannot today.  As someone who lived in Texas for most his life and relocated to Charlotte by way of the northeast I was in great need of good Mexican.  Sadly I never got the chance due to logistics.  The food maybe good but I never got the opportunity to eat.  Upon arrival at 6pm my party of 4 were told it was to be 30 min.  Well that's acceptable.  45 min later we finally asked the status and the repose was 10 more min.  Where's the apology?  Well 10 minutes pasted and still not seated.  In actually a party of 5 whom arrived approx. 15 min after our arrival was seated.  So needless to say we walked.  A restaurant makes money on turning tables and Mexican restaurants typically do a great job at this due to the nature of Mexican food.  However, Cantina 1511 does not have logistics and management in place.  I hope to give it another go as the Mexican food choices in Ballantyne is very limited with Cantina 1511 cornering the market.  Know that my review is only to help as I want this place to succeed.

WVVVbfJr_O_yB72kU8tRlw.text: If you were thinking of going to Cantina 1511 for Queens Feast 2013, stop thinking and just GO! Their menu includes four courses, and half price bottles of wine. How can you go wrong?  We went last night, for the first night of QF 2013 and had a blast. Our waiter, Javier, was attentive and really wonderful. If we go back, we'll ask for him again.  The food was amazing. For the first course, they serve you guacamole with your chips. For two people, you get a smaller bowl of guacamole than they usually make tableside, and it was really just mixed together at the table, not anything else. At first I was hoping for more, but I was only able to eat about a third of my entree by the time it arrived so really, the amount ended up being more than either of us needed.  I ordered the jicama and avocado salad for my 2nd course. It was HUGE! My husband ordered one of the soups which was also a generous portion. By the time my main arrived, the non-vegetarian enchilada dish, I was already nearing full. I ate a respectable third, but needed the rest to go in order to enjoy the Bananas Foster chimichanga they served along with ice cream at the end.  For wine, we had a bottle of the Pinot at $13, I think it was. For our normal dining out experience, it was a tad pricey (we normally don't eat anything but a main, maybe $15 per person) but for a Queen's Feast splurge the meal was generous and delicious, and the service was great.  Be sure to make a reservation, though! The place was packed.

dlRX8yazQVy3v3zJZfWgdA.text: We went here with a work function. There were about 12 of us so we got the use of half of a private room, the other half was being used by another group.   I got the chorizo sandwich with a cup of tortilla soup. The sandwich was good but very messy and very greasy. The soup I thought was very good.   The highlight of the meal to me was the salsa and queso. The queso comes with a little tealight to keep it warm. If that tealight goes out have someone re-light it soon, because the queso will become thick and not easy to eat once it gets cold.   Overall a great place for some Mexican, but I think I would rather go to a more authentic restaurant.

y1tfmmxBrKGx4ho9r7-9Ng.text: Cantina always satisfies my Mexian cravings every time. I always enjoy sitting outside on the patio and indulging on a mojito and over indulging on chips and salsa. I know several people were not happy with the changes in management but I have not noticed anything that would keep me from coming back. They have all the basics and they fix them perfectly ever time I've been.

2pq3VJ-oQ_W4FElLji8Kdg.text: I've read the negative reviews of Cantina 1511 but for me I have had only great experiences. My family and I have been to the restaurant a few times over the past couple of years. This week I had the chance to go two nights in a row. Both experiences were wonderful--the service (thanks Stan), the drinks and the food. I really like the made fresh guacamole. My coworker from Peru liked the habanero salsa so much she got some to go. Maybe it won't always be twice a week, but I'll eat at Cantina 1511 again.

I6SNDMU48-Pz8vs5QZv3Sw.text: Great food and great service! We ordered the Enchiladas Verde and the Fish tacos.Both were very good.  We started with the complimentary chips and salsa, and the salsa was very fresh and delicious. We will definitely be back.

1bXhoLJibQMX5AZsEGwX7w.text: Well, after perusing the Queen City for burritos and free chips and salsa on any occasion, Cantina 1511 has popped up on my radar a few times. Known for pitchers of sangria and fresh, tableside guac, it might as well be a bulls eye.   We've stumbled in on multiple occasions to this location. Friday nights, Saturday nights and Sunday afternoons. Optimal time for us is a weekend afternoon. Not buzzing with margarita vultures and other seekers of neon drinks with umbrellas in them. We're just here for the food, typically. However, I've seen quite a few neon blue margaritas floating around. They must be doing something right. Just not my cup of tea....er...booze.   My wife and I love the mushroom and goat cheese quesadilla. Perfectly simple and just enough pungent flavor to keep everything interesting. The goat cheese works perfectly with crispy, buttery outer shell of the tortilla. It's somewhat phyllo-esque upon each bite. So flaky and fragile. The mushrooms could be sauteed a bit better, but the flavors are all there. Huge win.   The tableside guac is an absolute win. Perfect amount for a table of four or two starvacious diners. Balanced well with tomatoes, onion and citrus. I'm not a huge fan of guac that has too many additives. Cantina does it up right. Smooth avocado and the rest of the veggies take care of the chunky aspects. My only gripe is the chips they give you to dip with. Not flat. All folded and intermingling with one another. I want my chips to be separate. Playing by their own rules. Not hugging one another. The flavor is all there. Just too much fraternization.   Love Cantina. Now, to expand my horizons and check out some of this ever-present booze they have going on. Cheers!

4lVFQ5O3X-brumy5rH3S6g.text: My sister and I ate there yesterday.  The chicken enchiladas were not good.  Left a funky taste in our mouths.  When we got home we both got sick.  Called and talked to a manager today.  Basically said they would do nothing for us.  Needless to say.  We will not be back !!!

I_P9IWRIWD12E207g_BX2g.text: Just experienced the worst food at Cantina 1511 in Stonecrest. So disappointed with the Crab and Avocado Quesadilla. My daughter and I have enjoyed them here in the past. The Quesadillas had barely any crab meat or avocado. It was primarily large globs of cheese.

0HzfzFv548aWM9m4vPCGIw.text: This was the first time that we've eaten here and we really enjoyed it!  I had the pork burrito and my husband had the enchiladas and queso. The salad with the burrito was amazing   Can't wait to go back !!

qIhFxI8P0yDRgKlP128XPA.text: I had a terrible experience at Cantina 1511 this evening. We had our orders messed up twice with no remorse from the restaurant. The first time was no big deal - they brought out beef nachos instead of chicken and so we had the waitress switch it out. The second time they messed up on my wife's quesadilla and brought out chicken instead of carne asada. When we told the waitress about the mistake, she did not know that carne asada was different than chicken. When she got her manager she asked if she could send a carne asada quesadilla home with us. We said ok, my wife can just eat at home. When we got our bill, they charged us for the quesadilla that they were sending home with us. Even though my wife wasn't even going to be able to eat her food at the restaurant, they charged us full price. We had a coupon so we used that to get a discount. When we were leaving the restaurant, the manager stopped by and I let her know I was disappointed that they charged us for the quesadilla she said she was sending home with us. She just offered to give us our coupon back and never once apologized and made us feel like it was our fault for the mess up. Very terrible customer service. Needless to say we won't be going here anymore.

Dq-rG_NEd8phbH_vTdoxNw.text: I love Cantina 1511 - we go here all the time, and by and large have always had wonderful experiences, especially when we dine in the restaurant.  I do, though, want to warn y'all about their online ordering - I've used it about 3 times now, and they've never got my order correct. Tonight, for example, I ordered 2 Ancho Pollo tacos, no pico de gallo and not lettuce, and then another 2 taco plate of 1 Ancho Pollo, 1 Marco Pollo. What we received was 2 orders of the 2-taco plates, both with 2 Ancho Pollo tacos with everything - so they didn't affect the modifications to the first order, and they got the 2nd plate only half correct. When I've ordered by phone, the order has always been correct, so I guess I'll forgo the online ordering if favor of the good old fashioned telephone - since clearly they don't have their house in order there.  Love you, Cantina, but if you're going to enter the 21st century, I encourage you to get it right. It's just annoying to offer online ordering and get the order more than 1/2 wrong.

B6MXyOvcV5inpWkw8hRv8g.text: The atmosphere was great, we were in and out in an hour, on Saturday night. Table side guacamole was great, it would have been nice to have a choice of spice/hot level. The Birdsong Jalapeno APA (American Pale Ale), was a great beer, it is a full body beer with a hint of pepper that fads away, making it easy to drink. My wife got the house margarita (frozen) and said it was one of her favorites.

kpEglOLx9W2Zvnzk_N3New.text: Received great service!  The server was Chelsea. She was prompt and friendly. Excellent food. Be prepared to ask for a doggie bag!  Large portions!  Margaritas are very good as well. Will go back!

wMTllNTjHjByOQ4prZyXIg.text: I started out the night wanting "authentic" Mexican instead of Cantina as usual. What a huge mistake. Cantina is always packed and on the pricier side for a reason. We ended up walking out of the place we were currently eating at and booked our table at Cantina before we had even paid the chevk. Chips are outstanding, margaritas are fresh and I'm never disappointed. Our server Scott was very friendly and incredibly helpful with picking a tequila. It might not seem "authentic" since it's a chain but it certainly is. If you're looking for good, fresh tasting Mexican, this is the only place we've found in Ballantyne that delivers A+ every time.

XK0DQl8JCXcKI_s5X33wZg.text: Chips and salsa were great! Thin, crispy chips and spicy red salsa. Ask for the green tomatillo salsa as well. Other diners said the shrimp taco and tortilla soup were really good.   My meal was average. Chopped salad with almost no flavor, grilled vegetables that I could do better at home, and queso dip that had a good base but lacked salt or any other flavor.

_FVszlPUV8IuEA-fAFOLmw.text: We came up here from Rock Hill and we were hungry and love Mexican food, so we thought we'd give this place a try. It did have a "chain feel" even though there are only 2 locations. We had the fajitas. I was not really that impressed at all. The fajitas were just okay, we've definitely had better at chain restaurants in California like El Toritos. Someone here on Yelp said the chips and salsa were good - and I would strongly DISagree! They were passable and the salsa was NOT. The salsa was pretty much for local gringos, not at all for California gringo transplants - we LOVE good Mexican food, and I don't think I will return here. If you want good authentic Mexican food, this isn't the place. If you want "americanized" Mexican food, then this is a good spot for you. Our service was great, top notch, so nothing lacking here for us other than our tastebuds.

6IOkRVq3ohlvnJOIqiAaZA.text: Food is good...Service was terrible.  My husband and I had to ask 4 times (asked different people still no silverware,  one person even said they were washing it, guess they need to raise the silver pare level here) to get silverware to eat our meal with.  It got so bad that my husband asked a different server walking by our table if they even have any silverware, by the time we got silverware our food was cold) Absolutely NO manager presence on the floor at all.  Restaurant really is good food wise but the management team is not doing anything to make the service/dining experience work.  Try replacing management or at least have them visible to the patrons and then train the service staff.

PM2tHM9iZ3jnexwq3PS5tA.text: I used this restaurant for a corporate team building dinner and paint event. There was mixup with the event coordinator who booked us at the other location. I was very stressed as I had about 30 people counting on dinner and the other location was 45 minutes away. This location was able to work with me to allow us to have the event there even though they were not expecting us. The staff was very friendly, helpful, courteous, attentive, etc. My team really enjoyed the food, beverages, and service. I would definitely come here again.

SVHGTPx-oER5drfDayakgw.text: Place is ok. Margaritas are good and chips are ok. You can tell this is not an authentically owned Mexican restaurant. Food is ok at best.

ray51ls3gPtY5L7lgL_xmw.text: Chef Greg's Avacado Bake and half price Mimosa's and Sangria for Sunday brunch. Delicious!

whkbDmlZc2gz3yHhRl1ewg.text: Very nice Mexican restaurant. The portions are big and the price was reasonable. Great selection of Margaritas. Make sure to call for a reservation and parking can be a little tricky.

BKe4tgHyAeBxf0bvz2t5Lg.text: Had lunch there today (Thursday). Food was great which is why I gave them 3 Stars. My recommendation is not to sit in the bar. The bartender, never gave his name and seemed distant, and distracted. Almost unapproachable. I felt I was imposing asking for more iced  The salsa had a little extra heat which I enjoyed.  Chips were crisp and yummy. I had the mushroom quesadilla  which was outstanding.  Like I said, I wouldn't recommend sitting in the bar area unless you have to. This was not my first visit and I've never seen this particular bartender. But he was so off putting that I felt others should know. Stay away from the bar on Thursday mornings. Other than that I highly recommend.

_SH5XEr7NPlCh_UYJa63Jg.text: Best tacos in Charlotte! Love that you can order multiple kinds on one order allowing you to mix things up each visit and try new things. And.. you should order the Queso that they pour over their burritos. It is even better than the one on their appetizer menu. Highly recommend!

K0jvvmF0XI-bK3Ifblkdkg.text: Great food. Good portions and the Margaritas were good. They staff was pretty friendly as well. I was also thrilled that I could watch College football as well. Pretty Authentic place. I would go again.

YDD0qSIggS_2zelnlAPz3Q.text: Hardly a True TexMex joint, more like Mexican fusion. There's a few things on the menu that are really good, but most is not very TexMex style. The fish tacos are good, as well as the steak chimichanga. The chips and salsa are really good, but this place is way over priced for what you get. I'll be so glad when chuys opens up for TexMex!

yg59miaAhLj3RSbMN75VTg.text: Service was good beer was good and food was OK A nice touch is that they bring you warm chips and salsa chips tasted homemade as well as salsa Plenty of TV 's to watch games Rodger the bartender was very good Prices are good for value  Will go back

9qtiASePdRJdpIFahD-tXw.text: Wife and I came here after church today. We had a hankering for some good Mexican food as we had been a patron of the original 1511 on East Blvd. the place was not bust but probably about a third to half full. We were seated right away. Our server was johnny on the spot and took drink orders. That's where the quick service ended. The drinks finally came and we ordered the fajita platters. We waited an inordinate amount of time. When we finally got our food it was warm to hot but not sizzling fajita hot if you know what I mean. We witnessed another table that ordered fajitas and these was. Smoking hot and sizzling. Not sure what the issue is but that's why we gave the two star rating.   Chips and salsa was great. The waitress was friendly but there is an issue here that needs addressed. We will give them another try again in the future.

q23qZwMSgjoQcRtpZVeYMg.text: I really wanted to like Catina...but was disappointed.  We went on a Friday night and waited only 20 minutes for 2 people which wasn't too bad. The girl who sat us walk so much faster than us to the table and didn't even say anything before walking away. Our waiter was very friendly on the other hand. He brought out chips but they were out of containers for the salsa so we had to wait about 10minutes for salsa and I will say it was well worth the wait! The salsa is delicious! We ordered the house margaritas that was also really good and fairly strong! So the reason for the 2 stars, the delicious salsa and margaritas. Now for the food.....I ordered the enchilada suiza. Very disappointing. The chicken was so dry and tough! I barely ate my meal. I was wishing for more sauce to help with the dryness but they were lacking in sauce as well....such a bummer!

jeUGb5v5Qgk95wdgneqgfQ.text: Food was horrible and service was not good... Our waitress disappeared half way through our meal...  The fajitas where not cooked very well... He chicken was not cooked all the way... The tortillas where cold.... Horrible experience....

uyDtRyjfOb9akYxntCA3YA.text: My family came in town and we called ahead to make sure we had a table. When we arrived we found that another family lied and said they were the ones that called ahead. The staff quickly got us one of their private rooms pulled together and had us seated. Honest people: 1 Liars: 0. The food was ridiculously amazing. Everything from the at the table guacamole with bacon and jalapenos to ever entree was dilicious. Our waiter Stan M. #1107 (this guy needs a promotion) was very courteous, funny and had an all around approachable and comical personality that made us feel at home. We all left full, happy and the trip made our evening. Will most definitely be going back for more of their dilicious food!

qzsGsUVAS3C-ciND3vElhg.text: Short staffed during our first time! Led to very delayed service. We hope it was just a one time thing, but will try again!

_etEfubTBh1x8bMgt5n-2Q.text: Good Mexican food but nothing too special about it. Good quality, cool atmosphere but nothing that really stood out as a wow factor. Would definitely go back because it was good but hoping for something stand out next time around.

43muWOofWX2t4IzHldmhhw.text: STOP MESSING WITH CHIPS AND SALSA!  So on two recent occasions I've been here and the chips are different.  I, like many others, am a huge fan of Cantina's chips and salsa.  Chips are salty white corn tortilla chips and salsa is just plain awesome.  Family went on Saturday morning and were given these cheap crappy unsalty bland YELLOW corn tortilla chips.  You know, the ones you get at most cheap Mexican restaurants.  The first time this happened (maybe four months ago), I pointed it out to the waiter who effectively told me I didn't know what I was talking about and acted all coy.  When it happened on Saturday, waitress told me sometimes the new people overcook the chips.  I don't know if the restaurant runs out of the good chips and has to settle for the crappy chips but there is effort being made to conceal the fact that they are using inferior chips.  A conspiracy I tell ya!  Anyway, for real, the chips and salsa are the main reason I come here, and if I'm going to be flipping a coin every time I show up as to whether I'm going to be happy, I'll have to find somewhere else to eat.

YQsk3443LnldjcVVjMGHTw.text: Greeting and food service was on the slow side to be 3PM and pretty empty. We were standing upfront for about 15 minutes and literally no one stopped to check our status or seat us. Once seated, our server Luke was definitely helpful and on point with his drink and taco suggestions though.   We had the street corn as an appetizer, total waste of $4. Corn on the cob (probably the smallest I've ever seen), lathered in oil and a sprinkle of cheese. I was expecting at least a juicy piece of corn and all the things that would make it almost worth spending $4 for & even more so "Mexican Street Corn". I had the shrimp and Al Pastor tacos with saffron rice and opted for sweet plantains instead of beans ($2 upcharge). Tacos were pretty tasty (that's what the one star is for), plantains were burnt on some ends and they were all stuck together. Saffron rice would've been good had I not chomped on a few hard clusters of rice.   I went back on yelp and saw the South Park location had better reviews - because I really wanted to like this place,  I'm willing to give Cantina 1511 another shot but at the South Park location. One star for the tacos alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina 1511 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Saffron rice, sweet plantains (ok) shrimp &amp; pork tacos were good! Street corn, not so much. I could&#39;ve made it better at  home.

ObQYDYM2cviAPQTew1oVAw.text: Probably one of the worst Mexican restaurants I have ever been to I ordered the shrimp fajitas pretty simple right ? wrong!! $30 and I got maybe six rubbery shrimp on a bed of what looked like every vegetable in the refrigerator that they wanted to throw out along with the guacamole that wasn't good along with the salsa that tasted like it was nothing more then canned tomato sauce - needless to say I will not be back

NqkanMTsJiPI4audxDbA5A.text: Eat and drink here!  I'm from Europe and staying in Charlotte every second month. I'm used to good food at home where people put passion into the cooking. It's unusual that I go back to resturants in US but this is one of them.  This place has great food, not typical mexican but more upscale and the service is great :)

P-HLK_HtY_yQ2rgFssPVwg.text: This is a nice Mexican restaurant. The atmosphere is very peaceful and just very relaxing. Service here is wonderful and everyone is very welcoming and polite.  I ordered a "tanga chicken burrito" and replaced my sides with rice and everything came out beautifully. The burrito was exquisite and detail was very much paid attention to while making it.   The queso was  to die for so I highly recommend to everyone who goes there to get the "five cheese Queso fundido" as an appetizer. You won't regret it!   This is one of the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to.

T5nYQhZzpwS4usfBOrpCMQ.text: Way too pricey for the food quality. Underwhelming service.  I'm still unsure,  after all these years,  why this place is so popular!

jcWQs3jFAEXYXp_uxg56tw.text: This place was solid but not spectacular.  The menu is limited and combines some really weird things together.   However, the combinations turned out to be delicious .   The service was also very solid and far better than I am used to elsewhere.  I only have it 4 stars because of the menu options.  It took my girlfriend and I like 25 minutes to make a decision on what to order.   I would give this place a solid B+ and we would certainly consider it among our options in the future

jDLzmjs6_kn0LfomfPPB-A.text: At best, two stars... The chips and salsa were good, but it kind of ends there. What happened to this place? I ordered a beef chimichanga that seemed to have more rice than anything in it. The waited forgot my husband's soup (2nd choice as they didn't have their house soup available)- so no soup for you!  After dinner was over, we looked toward dessert (it was Valentine's Day so some chocolate seemed appropriate) only to be informed that 3 of the 5 desserts listed were also unavailable- apparently a major menu 'revamp' is in the works, but for now you can basically have some key lime pie. Disappointed- won't be back.

Y1gawzVRM4E_ibCAQAm6OQ.text: We love Cantina 1511! We usually go at least once a week whether it be for brunch, lunch, dinner or just drinks. The customer service is as good as it gets, especially in the bar area. Chelsea, Roger and Julian are just awesome. We've tried just about everything on the menu and everything is delicious. We love the burgers on the menu, I believe these were added to the menu in the past year or so. The guacamole made table side, the quesadillas, fajitas, tacos - everything is fantastic. And did I mention we love the bar staff :) Cantina is our favorite place!

lxY0rvWty1olMo_I4ByYeQ.text: Went to Cantina 1511 over the weekend and have been there a few other times over the last year; we've literally had the exact same experience every time: painfully bad service and decent Mexican food. This location is seriously in my no fly zone just based off how bad the service is here. Our food has always taken way longer than it should and some part of our order is inevitably screwed up. The wait staff and front desk are super friendly, but god help me something needs to change about the dine-in service.   Aside from the service, Cantina 1511 doesn't do anything particularly well. The Margaritas are usually over-priced and too sugary. The food is fine, but not anything better than any other Mexican restaurant int the Charlotte area. Truthfully, the only reason we went this weekend was because it was close, and we are SUPER lazy.   I wouldn't necessarily recommend against Cantina, but I wouldn't go out of my way to tell people to go here.

rFclZobWIh30bquwzQ3PhA.text: I went here on a Saturday night at 7pm and as crowded as it was (1.5hr wait) we just hung around the bar area and picked up the first free spot. It ended up being a high top table and they just cleaned off the cups and plates from the people before us. It's first come first serve for that whole area - there's booths, the bar, and a few long tables. The queso was really good and filling. I got the chicken quesadilla and I am not kidding, it was THE BEST quesadilla I've had in my life. Definitely coming back when I'm in the area again.

oZNZ9FiKT3k2GfCQVbe85g.text: Ok, I'm going to start of by saying our waitress was super friendly, and my friend and I received our lunch fairly quickly.   1. The Guacamole: Cantina offers table side guac, which is great for those who love their guac freshly made. You can't really mess up guac, or maybe you can. In this instance, she did. The guac was flavorless and kind of soupy. I'm not sure how the soupy part happened, but it did. Maybe the pico de gallo was missing cilantro or something? SOMETHING WAS MISSING and I can't put my finger on it. And I won't. I'll never order their guac again.   2. Chicken Tostada Salad: According to the menu, this salad is piled high with marinated chicken breast. Um, where was the chicken? I barely received any and I for sure didn't receive any marinated chicken. The chicken on my salad looked like cubed chicken that came out of a can. Totally underwhelmed and disappointing.   3. Churro Bread Pudding: What in the bland heck is this? I've never tasted a dessert that had absolutely no flavor. Our waitress suggested it to us and said it was the best dessert on the menu. Well, if this is the best dessert on the menu, I don't ever want to taste any of the other desserts. Ever.   If you couldn't tell, I love flavor. I love spices. When I go to a Mexican restaurant, or any restaurant, I expect for my tastebuds to be happy.   Maybe if I ordered a taco or a burrito, maybe I would have had a better experience? Who knows? I don't know - and I will never know, because I will not be back.

N6SY6Oins__uxu3uCdzi-g.text: Came here for brunch after church!  I went with the french toast & jalapeno bacon.  Such a great decision, the french toast was delicious and I would put it up against any I have had previously.  Wished the bacon had more jalapeno flavor, but still tasty!  Will definitely do this again!!

V2cZeNU6uslUmNXAPX0I8g.text: Trash. Poor bartender didn't have any help. Inattentive manager just walked around commenting about the bartender slacking while not helping in any way. Bartender had several patrons at bar with us and a couple tables while also trying to manage to go orders and reservations because the hostess was also elsewhere. This led to poor service. No fault of hers but food service is a team effort. We were there at 4:00 on a Monday afternoon, the restaurant was not busy. Dirty tables all around our section of the restaurant that were not attended to. Both of our orders were wrong but we didn't bother to complain because it seemed pointless and figured no one would help since everyone in this restaurant had a "one for all" mentality.
